Divina S. is from the village of Christian Village, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 33 years old. Divina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Divina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Divina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Divina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Divina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Divina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Christian Village, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: T. Christine est née le 13 Janvier 1956 et est mariée à HEKPAZO Rigobert. Christine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Christine a un autre enfant à sa charge. Il y a environs dix huit ans que Christine vit au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Christine n'a pas été à l'école. Christine a un moulin à maïs à son domicile où elle fait la transformation du maïs en farine de maïs à ses clients. Parallèlement, Christine vend des produits vivriers (maïs) à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Christine achète ses produits vivriers. Christine exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année et a obtenu déjà deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'augmenter son stock de produits, Christine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Christine T. was born on January 13, 1956 and is married to Rigobert HEKPAZO. Christine is the mother of two children; both are in school. Christine has another child in her care. Christine has lived with her husband and children in the Fidjrossè neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, for about eight years. The couple provides for the family’s various needs together. Christine did not attend school. She has a corn mill at home where she turns corn into corn flour for her customers. At the same time, Christine sells staple goods (corn) at home. Christine buys her staple goods in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She has engaged in this business for ten years and has already obtained two loans that have been completely repaid. Christine is applying for a third loan from ALIDé with the goal of increasing her stock of products.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn

loans.name: Rosalva Patricia

texts.es:
Rosalva de 25 años, , vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil ( zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). Vende productos de uso personal, como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. 

Ella para poder independizarse y ya no depender de sus padres buscaba una manera de general dinero hasta que una amiga le hablo de Yambal, decidió trabajar como vendedora Yambal ( empresa que da oportunidad a las mujeres que quieren superarse vendiendo productos de belleza a un bajo precio). Poco a poco con esfuerzo ha podido tener clientela. 

Para poder construir mejor su casa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento y bloques. En el futuro quiere seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Rosalva, age 25, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a periurban zone with an ecology that is breaking down). She sells products for personal use like perfume, creams, and deodorants, etc. In order to be able to be independent and not depend upon her parents, she looked for a way make money. A friend told her about Yambal, and she decided to work as a salesperson for Yambal (a company that gives women who want to improve themselves the opportunity to do so by selling beauty products at a low price) . Little by little, with effort, she has been able to get customers. In order to better build her house she wants to use the loan to buy cement and blocks. In the future she wants to continue improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement and blocks

loans.name: Hugo Leonel

texts.es: Hugo tiene 51 años de edad vive solo en el país su esposa se encuentra en el extrajero hace 2 años ella obtuvo visa de contrato y trabaja en los Estados Unidos, Hugo con su esfuerzo pudo comprar hace aproximadamente 8 años un equipo para discoteca y ahora le agradece a Dios por ello, lo alquila para cualquier evento que a él lo contaten y de so obtiene sus ganacias. A parte de eso el es maestro de educación Física y Arbitro a la vez. A Hugo lo contratán 3-4 veces a la semana, él es ambulante alquila su equipo o instrumento de sonido en San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, o en cualquier lugar donde soliciten sus servicios. Solicita el crédito para comprar una bocina ya que la que tenia se arruino y quiere comprar una nueva y vender la viejita, también una consola ya que le es muy útil y le urge, también una luces de a colores ya que tiene solo de un color. Su sueño es tener 2 alquileres de equipos o instrumentos para discoteca o/y a parte de eso contratar a un cantante cristiano ya que lo solicitan mucho para las bodas.
texts.en:
Hugo, age 51, lives alone in the country. His wife has been living abroad for two years. She got a work visa and works in the United States. Through his efforts Hugo was able to buy discotheque equipment eight years ago. Now, he thanks God for it. He rents it out for various events that he is hired for, and that is how he gets his income. Besides that, he is a physical education teacher and a referee. Hugo is hired 3-4 times a week. He is an itinerant worker who rents his equipment or sound instument in San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, or in any other place where they request his services. His is requesting a loan to buy a loudspeaker because the one he has is ruined. He wants to buy a new one and sell the old one. He also wants a large instrument board because they are very useful and he urgently needs it. Also, he will buy some colored lights because he only has one color. His dream is to have two sets of rental equipment or discotheque instruments and or use part of this to contract a Christian singer because they are requested a lot for weddings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invert more in his business

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn H. is from the village of Christian Village, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 32 years old. Edelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Edelyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edelyn is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Edelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Christian Village, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Cristhiam Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristhiam lo integran tres mujeres joviales, trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes entre risas y bromas hicieron más ameno la entrevista. La coordinadora del grupo es María José P. quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosmético negocio que inicio hace cuatro años con poco capital con la compra de algunos cosméticos.

Esta señora emprendedora cuando habla de la miscelánea que desea construir se le ilumina el rostro, se  vista chispea y describe con tan emoción y precisión dicha meta en el que habrá un cubico para cosméticos, de ropa y confites según dijo.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Karla Patricia Hernández se dedica al comercio de ropa y productos para niños y Cenia Delfina Pérez Poveda vende variedad de productos desde perfumes, ropa, cosméticos etc.
texts.en:
The Cristhiam group is comprised of three cheerful, hard-working, and enterprising women. Between laughs and jokes they made the interview more enjoyable. María José P. is the coordinator of the group. She has a business selling clothing and cosmetics. She started the business four years ago. She used a little capital to buy some cosmetics. This enterprising woman’s face lights up and she sparkles when she talks about the small general store that she wishes to build. She describes her goal with much emotion and precision. She will have a place for cosmetics, clothes, and sweets. Karla Patricia Hernández, a colleague in the group, sells clothing and products for children. Cenia Delfina Pérez Hernández, another colleague, sells a variety of products from perfume to clothes and cosmetics, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda H. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, South Cotabato. She is 48 years old. Medarda is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Medarda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Medarda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Medarda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Medarda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Medarda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Medarda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Reyna C. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el Barrio las Arenas de la Ciudad de Choluteca, Reyna se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de tortillas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. 
Reyna es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales 2 los tiene estudiando en un colegio publico de su comunidad.
Reyna se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para empezar su produccion, hace unas ricas tortillas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materia prima para la fabricacion de las tortillas ya que en estos momentos sus ventas han mejorado pero la produccion que tiene es muy poca y se queda sin vender tortillas, esto le esta ocasionando perdidas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y para salir adelante con su familia, darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
su sueño es ver graduados a sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna C., age 40, lives in the Arenas neighborhood in the city of Choluteca. Reyna makes and sells tortillas. Her business is located in her house. Reyna has three children. Two of them are in the community’s public school. Reyna gets up at four every morning to start her production of making delicious tortillas. She will use the loan to buy raw material to make tortillas. At this time her sales have been improving. But, her production is very small, and she is left without tortillas to sell. This is causing losses. She needs the income to cover the household expenses and for her family to get ahead. She also needs it to give her children a better quality of life. Her dream is to see her children graduated and to see them become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood, lime powder, corn flour, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: K. Elisabeth est née en 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AHOUANGAN Bonaventure, un chauffeur, Elisabeth est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elisabeth vit avec sa famille au quartier Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis quatorze ans environs. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins et venir en aide à son mari, Elisabeth vend diverses boissons et divers autres produits à Gbogbanou à Cotonou. Elisabeth s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elisabeth exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année et avait bénéficié quatre fois déjà de crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Elisabeth désire développer davantage son activité et augmenter ses stocks de produits pour mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Elisabeth K. was born in 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Bonaventure AHOUANGAN, a chauffeur, Elisabeth is the mother of four school-aged children. She has lived with her family in the Agbalilamè neighborhood, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, for approximately fourteen years. The couple share the various familial responsibilities. Elisabeth did not go to school. In order to provide for their needs and to help her husband, Elisabeth sells various beverages and other products in Gbogbanou in Cotonou. Elisabeth gets her supplies in Dantopka, the international market of Bénin. She has engaged in this business for ten years and has already received four loans from ALIDé that she has repaid in full. Elisabeth would like to further develop her business and increase her stock of products so as to better respond to the increasing demand of her customers. That is what has led her to ask for a fifth loan.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beverages.

loans.name: Hassan T.

texts.en:
Hassan is a hardworking and determined businessman. He has a business centre at Campbell Street Makeni. He is married and his wife is also in business. He also has dependents. He was able to secure funds from the sales of pharmaceutical drugs. He has done this business for the past five years.
Hassan's challenge is how to cope with the high cost of transportation and the frequent increase in the wholesale cost of Pharmaceutical drugs, in which he trades. He is in need of a loan to expand his business. He intends to use the proceeds from his loan to educate his children and to buy a vehicle for transport.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for pharmacy.

loans.name: Melva

texts.es: Melva tiene 46 años de edad, comparte su vida en compañía de su hija Amy de 7 años, juntas viven en una casa que le cedieron sus padres. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 4 años en la venta de golosinas, negocio que lo realiza dentro de su propio domicilio, en donde acondiciono un pequeño puesto. Desde entonces ofrece gran variedad de productos, que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes. Melva se siente contenta con su labor pues le da las ventajas que necesita para sentirse independiente y poder dedicarle tiempo a las labores de su hogar. En un futuro desea tener un negocio más fijo y rentable, es por ello que ha pensado en instalar una tienda. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Melva, age 46, lives in the company of her 7-year old daughter Amy in a house left to Melva by her parents. She is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking woman that has been running a sweet shop for 4 years. Melva runs the business out of her home, which she has equipped with a small stand. She offers a great variety of products and has great demand from her customers. Melva is very happy with her work and the advantages it brings her, such as feeling independent and being able to dedicate time to caring for her home. In the future, she hopes to have a more established and profitable business. To work towards this, she has thought of setting up a proper store instead of a small stand. This is her first loan with MFP, and she has always been very responsible with payments, With this loan, she plans to buy more merchandise to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to supply her sweet shop

loans.name: Richar Jaime

texts.es:
Richar de 37 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil ( zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). El tiene un taller radio técnico, arregla radios, equipos de sonido, televisores, etc. 

Por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar reparando equipos eléctricos y así mantener a su esposa y sus cinco hijos,  aprendió en un curso que estuvo. Desde ese tiempo el se ha dedicado a trabajar en su taller, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Para continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo repuestos para los equipos eléctricos, en el futuro el quiere adecuar mejor su vivienda para que sus hijos estén mas cómodos.
texts.en:
Richar, age 37, lives in Paraíso, (periurban area with an ecology that is breaking down). He has a radio technician shop. He fixes radios, sound equipment, and televisions, etc. For the lack of opportunities, he had to work repairing electrical equipment in order to support his wife and their five children. He learned in a course that he took. After that he has devoted himself to working in his workshop. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. In order to continue with his business he wants to use the loan to buy replacement parts for electrical equipment. In the future he wants to adapt his house better so that their children will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacement parts

loans.name: Clémence Sourou

texts.fr: D. Clémence Sourou est née en 1977 à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à AKIOSSOWE Michel, un électricien, Clémence Sourou est mère de six enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Clémence Sourou vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Agbalilamè , depuis près de douze ans. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Clémence Sourou n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Clémence Sourou vend des ustensiles de cuisine (casseroles en séries, bols et bassines en séries, etc.) de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Clémence Sourou vend de la bouillie de maïs. Clémence Sourou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Clémence Sourou exerce cette activité depuis sept ans  et est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Clémence Sourou désire aujourd’hui, rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Clémence Sourou sollicite auprès de ALIDé un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Clémence Sourou D. was born in 1977 in Agbalilamè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin. She is married to Michel Akiossowe, an electrician; She is the mother of six children who are all in school. She has been living with her children and her husband in the neighborhood of Agbalilamè for almost 12 years. The couple shares the various family expenses. Clémence Sourou did not attend school. To provide for her needs and those of her children she sells kitchen utensils door-to-door (set of pots, bowls, and sets of plastic tubs etc…). As a secondary job she sells hominy grits. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been practicing this activity for seven years. She is a previous customer of ALIDé who always pays back her loans. She would like to increase her level of activity and better meet her customers’ demands. This is why Clémence Sourou is requesting another loan from ALIDé

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.en:
Claudia is a 29 year old woman living in the Colombian capital of Bogotá. She sells small merchandise such as diaper bags, toys, baby perfume, and various disposable goods. Claudia has always wanted to be independent and self-sufficient. At the age of 23, she started a clothing business in neighboring Ecuador. Ten months ago she moved to Colombia and has brought her business with her. She's helped out by her sister so that she can study during the week to become a junior accountant. Claudia's trying hard to grow her business, searching for strategies to increase sales, and it's this dynamic character that brought her to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She has requested a micro-loan to stock up on inventory such as baby bottles, perfumes, carrying cases, towels (all goods that fly off the shelves), and movies to show at her store. Looking forward, she hopes to finish her studies and to apply her skills as an accountant to make her business even more profitable.

[EN ESPANOL]

Claudia Milena Pajajaoy de 29 años vive en Bogotá la capital de Colombia, ella es una joven que  se dedica a la comercialización  de mercancías  como pañaleras, juguetería, colonias para bebes y  desechables en general.  Claudia Milena siempre ha estado interesada en ser   independiente y autosuficiente, por eso desde sus 23 años se inició como empresaria  en  Ecuador, un país vecino de Colombia,  en él que se dedicó a la comercialización  de ropa y desde hace 10 meses inició su miscelánea en el conjunto residencial donde vive en la ciudad de Bogotá; su negocio es atendido por su hermana y por ella, que lo hace los fines de semana, porque estudia la carrera técnica de auxiliar contable. Tiene como su principal meta  ampliar más su negocio, buscando estrategias para incrementar las ventas, por eso con el dinamismo que la caracteriza, acudió a la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo, donde esta aplicando por un crédito por valor de  $700.000 COP, con él va a  comprar  mercancías como teteros, colonias, estuches, paños y películas para surtir su negocio con esta mercancía que tiene una muy buena rotación. Más adelante su meta es terminar su carrera y aplicar los conocimientos a su negocio para hacerlo cada vez más rentable.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory such as baby bottles, perfumes, carrying cases, towels.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
La señora  Elsa Marina C.  se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace cinco (5) Años,  ella  solicita un segundo crédito KIVA para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que cada día trata  de  surtir su producto para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ella vende güipiles, blusas, cortes, fajas, suéteres, ropa de niños, rebosos y bolsos para damas en estos días le ha agregado a su negocio la venta de pasteles que ella elabora lo cual significa una ayuda mas para seguir al luchando al lado de su esposo para lograr metas y sueños que toda pareja tiene y al ver crecer a sus dos (2) niñas.

Ella dice que los créditos que ha tenido en FAPE, le han ayudado a ir logrando que su negocio  cada día esté  más grande, ya que con ese capital tiene la oportunidad de llevar a cabo sus planes.
texts.en:
Elsa Marina C. has been selling typical clothing for five years. She is requesting her second Kiva loan in order to continue investing in her business. She tries to stock her store everyday to meet her customers’ needs. She sells “güipiles” (a traditional embroidered shirt for women), blouses, “cortes” (traditional skirt), belts, sweaters, children’s clothes, shawls, and purses for women. She has now added the sale of cakes, which she makes, to her business. This means more help as she continues to struggle at her husband’s side to reach goals and fulfill the dreams that each couple has as they watch their two daughters grow. She says that the loans she has had from FAPE have helped her to have her business get bigger everyday. With this capital she has the opportunity to complete her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Continue investing in stocking her business

loans.name: Domitila De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Domitila de Jesus B. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la colonia Brisas del Sur de la ciudad de Choluteca. Domitila se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para dama y caballero, ella nos comento que este negocio es bueno porque comprando los fardos viene mucha ropa de buena calidad, marca y en muy buen estado. Cada pieza de ropa su costo es bajo, entonces ella vende barato y tiene buenas ganancias.
la ropa la vende al credito y al contado, tiene muchos clientes fijos todos los meses. Las ventas se han aumentado y para esto es que necesita el credito, para comprar un fardo de ropa y asi tener mas variedad de ropa.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y para su familia.
Domitila es una persona muy amable es agradable estar con ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Domitila de Jesus B., age 54, lives in the Brisas del Sur neighborhood of the city of Choluteca. Domitila is engaged in the sale of used men’s and women’s clothing. She commented to us that this business is good because she is buying bales containing a lot of good quality, name brand clothes in good condition. The cost of each article of clothing is low. She sells cheaply and has good earnings.

She sells clothes for credit and cash and has a lot of the same customers every month. Her sales have increased. She needs a loan in order to purchase a bale of clothing and, thus, have a greater variety of merchandise.

She needs the earnings to cover her household expenses and to have a better quality of life for herself and her family. Domitila is a very good-natured person, and it is pleasant to be with her.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Ganiatou

texts.fr: K. Ganiatou est née en 1974 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Ganiatou est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont seulement trois sont à sa charge. Ganiatou est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses trois enfants à charge. Ganiatou vit au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une quinzaine d'année. Ganiatou subvient seule aux besoins de la famille, grâce au revenu de son activité. Ganiatou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Ganiatou vend en effet, des produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, mayonnaise, beurre, savons, huile végétale, vinaigrette, etc.) à son domicile. Ganiatou s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ganiatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui effectue bien les remboursements de ses crédits. Face à la concurrence grandissante, Ganiatou désire renforcer son activité afin d'accroître sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenus. C'est pour cette raison que Ganiatou sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ganiatou K. was born in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, in 1974. She is the mother of five children, all of whom have been educated. Only three of her children still live at home. Ganiatou is a widow who lives on her own with her three school aged children. She has lived in the Finagnon quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about fifteen years. Ganiatou has never been to school. Ganiatou manages the household on her own, thanks to the income from her business. She sells assorted merchandise (pasta, canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, mayonnaise, butter, soaps, vegetable oil, salad dressings, etc.) out of her home. Ganiatou buys her stock in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Ganiatou has been a client of ALIDé for some time, and has paid back her previous loans. Because of increasing competition, Ganiatou wants to grow her business so she can have a bigger client base and generate more income. This is why Ganiatou is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise (pasta, canned tomatoes and sardines, soaps, oil, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: Monsieur Demba D. est un sociétaire  de 42 ans  de la caisse de Baye Laye qui habite dans la localité  de Daroukhane. Il est membre depuis avril 2001 et a  déjà  rembourse 9 prêts  antérieurs. Il est marie et père  de 4 enfants qui ont entre 7 mois et 8 ans. En plus de sa famille il a en charge 4 autres  personnes. Par  conséquent  il  cumule 2 activités. D’une part Monsieur  D. est vendeur dans une pharmacie de la place après  plusieurs stages effectues. D’autres part il dispose d’un atelier de vulgarisateur  pour lequel il fait appel a son neveu qui l’aide dans la gestion. Il sollicite un crédit   de 400 000 frs prévu  pour le renforcement de son activiste  de vulgarisateur. L’accroissement de  ses bénéfices  pourra l’aider a mieux  supporter ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Demba D. is 42 years old and lives in the Daroukhane neighborhood. He has been a member of the Baye Laye credit institution since April 2001 and has already repaid 9 previous loans. He is married and the father of 4 children, aged from 7 months to 8 years. Besides his family, he is responsible for four other people. For that reason, he has taken on two jobs. For one job, he is a salesman in a local pharmacy, after having completed several internships. For the other, he has a tire repair workshop, which he manages with help from his nephew. He is asking for a loan of 400,000 francs to support his tire repair business. The increased profits will help him to better meet his household expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Emma Estela

texts.es: Emma tiene 56 años de edad, casada vive con su espso con el cual tienen 6 hijos de los cuales todos ya estan casados, gracias a que el negocio de Emma ha crecido bastante y que en la comunidad en la que ella vive ahora hay mas habitantes que hace 6 años cuando ella inicio su venta de articulos de consumo diario, el capital con el que ella esta trabajando ya no le alcanza y le solicita a la fundación un crédito para poder inveritr y suritr mas la tienda que actualmente tiene ya que la demanda de alimentos cada vez es mas grande y quiere agrandar el espacio de su tienda, como equiparla con vitrinas, estanterías, ya que le ayudara para que la tieneda tenga una mejor presentación, Emma ha trabajado en dos ocaciones con Kiva y agradece primeramente a  Dios la bendición de poder obtener los créditos y luego al personal de Kiva los fondos que le han brindando ya que cada crédito ha sido de una buena cantidad.
texts.en:
Emma, 56, is married and lives with her husband with whom she has six children, all of whom are already married. Thanks to Emma’s store having grown significantly and to the fact that there are more people who live in her community now than there were 6 years ago when she started selling consumer goods, the capital with which Emma is working is not enough. Thus she is requesting a loan to invest and restock her store since food demand keeps growing. Emma wants to enlarge her retail space and install cabinets and shelves so that the store has a better appearance. Emma has worked on two occasions with Kiva and she is grateful to God first and foremost for the blessing of obtaining credit and to the Kiva staff for the funds that they have provided since each loan has been a generous amount.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in Business

location.town: Comunidad Carmen del Monte, Barcenas, Villa Nueva

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is very interested in her business and has spent 15 years as a full-time business woman. Her business is located at # 2 Wilson Street, Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. Mabinty is married and has 3 children.


She was initially financed by her husband. She started a business trading firewood, palm oil and gara clothing which she has now been running for 15 years. She goes to work at 7:00a.m. and returns home at 6:45p.m. Her challenge is how to expand her business so that she can cover the high cost of transportation and price changes of the goods she trades in; and also support her family. She needs a loan to expand her business. She intends to use the proceeds from her business to educate her children to university level and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy gara cloth (locally dyed cloth) for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To supply their business's with added merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase men's and women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Ndiga

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiaga  B. est un commerçant  de 40 ans qui évolue  depuis plus de 25 ans dans l’achat et la vente de produits locaux divers (mil, mais, riz).Auparavant  il a démarré  avec l’activité  de charretier. Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff  depuis 2007 mais n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit. Il est marie et père  de  8 enfants qui ont entre 10 et 28 ans. C’est par l’intermédiaire  d’un ami qu’il s’est oriente dans ce commerce qui lui a beaucoup rapporte. Il sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat des produits qu’il commercialise afin de développer  d’avantage son activité  de commerce. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices  lui permettra de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndiaga B. is a 40-year-old storekeeper who has been advancing for the past 25 years in buying and selling diverse local products (millet, corn, rice). Before this, he had started selling things from a cart. He has been a member of the Yoff group fund since 2007 but has never taken a loan. He is a married father of 8 children between the ages of 10 and 28. It was the friend of a friend who introduced him to this business which has brought him a lot. He is seeking a loan for 500,000 francs to buy products that he sells in order to build up his business. The growth of his earnings will allow him to better meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO  VIRGEN D. FATIMA

Este grupo esta conformado por tres señoras la representante del es Claudia Elizabeth Y.  D. 26 años, tiene 3 hijos   menores D. 10 años,  su negocio es una tienda  que se encuentra ubicada en la casa D. su mamá, su tienda la tiene desD. año y medio y fue con la  ayuda con su esposo que pudieron establecer este negocio, solicita este crédito para poder surtir su tienda con más productos   para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, ya que en la aldea en la que vive es pequeña y está alejado del pueblo. Doña Ana Paulina C.   es viuda y tiene  2 hijos pequeños,  ella se dedica a la venta D. tamales  3 veces por semana desD. hace dos años, ella venD. sus tamales en su casa y ya sus clientes la conocer y la buscan,  su gran sueño ahora sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder darles una vida digna, Berta Mariana Y. se dedica a la venta D. productos D. desechable en Ciudad Quetzal donD. alquila un pequeño local  tiene 6 hijos,   3 mayores D. edad  y 3 menores D. edad, su plan para este crédito es comprar  más productos ya que en la cercanía no hay tanta competencia por lo que es importante tener  variedad D. productos desechables que sus clientes le piden.  Estas mujeres han demostrado ser muy trabajadoras y que a pesar D. contratiempos que han tenido siguen adelante y tienen muchos planes que involucran el poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias y el hecho D. que KIVA les apoye con un crédito para poder lograr sus planes y sueños, es algo que ellas aprecian mucho
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three women, who are represented by Claudia, 26. She has three children under 10 years old. Her business is a store located in her mother’s house. She has had her store for a year and a half. With help from her husband she was able to establish her business. She is requesting a loan in order to stock her store with more products to offer her customers, since the village she lives in is small and far from town. Ana is widowed with two small children. She has sold tamales three times a week for two years. She sells tamales in her home and her customers already know her and seek her out. Her dream now is to raise her children and to give them a good life. Berta works selling disposable products in Ciudad Quetzal where she rents a small shop. She has six children, three adults and three children. Her plan for this loan is to buy more products since there isn’t that much competition in the vicinity so it is important to have a variety of disposable products that her customers ask for. These women have proven to be hard workers and in spite of setbacks have continued to move forward and have many plans that involve improving the quality if their families’ lives. The fact that Kiva supports them with microloans in achieving their plans and dreams is something that they greatly appreciate.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest More in Their Businesses

loans.name: Ivonne Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivonne es una joven que le gusta trabajar con el objetivo de poder apoyar  a su familia,  madre de dos hijas, se dedica al negocio de venta de gaseosas, y venta de muebles, anteriormente vendía ropa, pero las ventas estaban malas y poco era lo que le quedaba de ganancias, y comenzó a descapitalizarse. 
Lo que con ayudada de su esposo logro poner ventas de muebles ya que el trabaja en una mueblería y saca productos los cual su esposa los vende en su casa. 
Muchas veces por encargos, han comenzado con poco, lo que quieren es comenzar a adquirir clientela y poder tener buen capital para una inversión mejor. Con este financiamiento compraran una variedad de productos como: gabetera con espejo, cabetero sin espejo, ropero de tres cuerpo ya que no tiene en existencia, para lograr obtener mejores utilidades. Y poder aportar con los gastos básicos de agua y luz.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a young woman who likes to work to support her family. The mother of two daughters, she works selling sodas and furniture. Previously, she sold clothing, but sales were bad and she did not earn much, so she got out of the business. She began to move into furniture sales with help from her husband, who works in a furniture store and is able to obtain products for her to sell out of their house. They have started this business with very little, and now want to expand their clientele and fulfill more order requests in order to gain resources and make better investments. With this financing they plan to buy a variety of products to increase their profits, including dressers with and without mirrors and a 3-door wardrobe, which they currently do not have in stock. They can also use the financing for basic utility costs such as water and electricity.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory of furniture products and cover utility expenses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Achat de jus de banane pour le revendre

loans.name: Ledis Maria

texts.en:
Ledis has a business selling hardware and other goods in the neighborhood of Barranquilla near one of Colombia's greatest soccer stadiums, “El Estadio metropolitano D. Barranquilla”. Her business has generated employment opportunities, staying open from 10am to 11pm daily. 


Ledis started her business in 1993 selling books in downtown Barranquilla, only later moving to her current neighborhood and changing her business model to focus on goods like stationary, hair ribbons and clips, wrapping paper and cosmetics. She also began to gradually add in hardware. Her main clients are locals and pedestrians who pass by her shop. She generally has to restock the store every two days. 


This loan will be Ledis's fourth with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to use it to buy a display case. She also plans to buy clothes in bulk (with cash) and, thereby, receive a better price: savings she can then pass on to her clients. Since starting out with FMSD, she has seen her family's income increase which is why she's so excited about continuing to growing in her large neighborhood. She already enjoys a solid reputation there and is surrounded by businesses and supermarkets attracting more potential clients.

[EN ESPANOL]

Ledis SaL. calderón, tiene un negocio D. variedades y ferreterías en la Ciudadela 20 D. Julio, barrio donD. está ubicado uno D. los mejores escenarios del futbol D. Colombia  “El Estadio metropolitano D. Barranquilla”.  Allí tiene su negocio D. variedades y ferretería donD. genera dos empleos y trabaja en los horarios D. 10:00 A.M. a 11:00 PM,. Ledis se inició como negociante en el año 1993 vendiendo libros en el centro D. Barranquilla, luego se pasó para la ciudadela 20 D. Julio comercializando variedades como papelería, adornos D. cabeza, accesorios, papel D. regalo, cosmeticos y fue agregando gradualmente artículos D. ferretería, sus principales clientes son los   peatones que pasan por el sector  y mucha gente que allí habita; ella tiene por costumbre  surtir su negocio cada dos días. Este es el cuarto crédito  D. Ledis con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, está solicitando un monto D. $1,300.000 COP, con el cual   comprará una vitrina y ropa al por mayor y D. contado, lo cual permite que se gane un descuento y mejore sus precios D. ventas al publico. DesD. que ingresó a esta organización siente que sus ingresos familiares  han mejorado, por eso está estimulada para seguir progresando sobre todo en este populoso barrio, donD. ya tiene renombre, y está rodeado D. negocios y supermercados que potencializan su clientela futura.

loans.use: to buy a display case and clothes in bulk

loans.name: Idda

texts.fr: Monsieur Idda F. est un jeune hôtelier  cuisinier de 31 qui habite dans la localité  de Yoff Mbenguene. Il exerce cette profession depuis 9 ans. Il est père  de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 7 ans. Il a choisi son métier  par passion. Il doit de l’argent à quelqu’un et il se trouve dans l’impossibilité  de payer intégralement  la somme due. Ainsi  il sollicite un crédit  a l’U-IMCEC afin de pouvoir rembourser mensuellement avec son salaire.   L’impact que pourra lui procurer ce financement  sera  un soulagement moral qui va le libérer. Par conséquent  il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs.
texts.en:
Mr Idda F. is a young hotel chef. He is 31 and lives in Yoff Mbenguene, He has worked in his chosen profession for 9 years. He is father of 2 children, aged between 3 and 7 years. He chose his profession out of passion. He owes money to someone and he finds himself unable to repay the required sum in full. He is therefore requesting credit from 'U-IMCEC' to combine with his salary in order to repay the money he owes monthly, The loan will relieve a great deal of emotional stress and allow him to live freely. He is therefore requesting credit of 150 000 frs.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: besoin social

loans.name: Las Responsables Y Intelectuales Group

texts.en:
Melida is the coordinator of her group Las Responsables y Intelectuales (The Responsible and Intellectual Ones), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her common-law husband and their three children.

Melida is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear by purchasing bras and panties to sell. She will use the profits to purchase pants for her children and save towards her long-term dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy bras and panties for resale

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye N. est un tapissier de 53 ans, membre de la caisse de Yoff  depuis avril 2007 et  qui habite dans la localité  de Yoff Tonghor. Mais parallèlement  il exerce le petit commerce base sur la vente de sacs. Bien qu’il ait fait une formation de tailleur son choix a été  porte sur la tapisserie pour gagner sa vie. Il sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs destine a l’achat de tissus et d’éponge  en vue de confectionner un salon destine a l’exposition et a la vente. Ce crédit  lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus et faire face aux difficultés  financières  auxquelles  il est confronte actuellement. Monsieur  N.  est marie et père  de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 15 ans.
texts.en:
Mr Abdoulaye N. is an upholsterer. He is 53 years old and has been a member of the Yoff UIMCEC credit union since April 2007. He lives in Yoff Tonghor. He simultaneously runs a small business selling bags. Although trained as a tailor, he chose to become an upholsterer in order to earn a living. He requests a loan of 200 000 frs in order to buy fabric and sponge, so that he can prepare a show room for exhibition and sales. This credit will allow him to increase his income and to confront the financial troubles he is currently facing. Mr N. is married and father of 4 children aged between 2 and 15 years.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investissement

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza 1 Group

texts.en:
Guillermina is the coordinator of her group La Union Hace La Fuerza (Union Makes Strength), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her common-law husband and their child.

Guillermina is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and beauty products by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her son with the goal of sending him to university some day. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing and Avon beauty products

loans.name: Dios Proveera 4,5,6 Group

texts.en:
Monica is the coordinator of her group Dios Proveera (God will provide), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Monica is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing blouses, pants, sheets, and skirts.

She will use the profits to save toward her goal of owning her own home.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, sheets, and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Petronila De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Petronila de los Ángeles G. se dedica arduamente a la venta de pan ofreciéndolo ambulantemente en las calles del mercado Mayoreo.

Petronila es una dama muy trabajadora y hoy en día ha logrado mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia gracias a su arduo esfuerzo. Con el crédito comprará el pan para continuar ofreciéndolo ambulantemente en las calles del mercado y también logrará comprar ropa en menores cantidades para ofrecerla de igual manera.
texts.en:
In the Market of Mayoreo, Mrs. Petronila de los Angeles assiduously dedicates herself to selling bread on the market streets. Petronila is a hard-working woman and at present, she has managed to improve the economic condition of her family, thanks to her arduous efforts. With this loan she will buy bread in order to continue offering it on the streets and, also, she wants to buy clothes in small quantities so that she can sell them in the same way.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BREAD TO SELL ON THE STREETS OF THE PUBLIC MARKET

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia es una emprendedora mujer, tiene 35 años, comparte su vida en compañía de uno de los dos hijos que tiene, puesto que es mayor e independiente. Juntos viven en su propia casa. Hace mas de 5 años se dedica en la venta de golosinas en las afueras de un colegio muy reconocido de la zona en la que vive. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo pues es tranquilo y además le da la oportunidad de ganar amigas. Por otro lado también prepara papa rellena, platillo que gusta mucho a los peruanos, además lo vende a un precio módico para que puedan adquirirlos los niños cuando salen del colegio. Es así que se encuentra muy contenta con el negocio y espera más adelante tener una tienda de comestibles o un restaurante, pero aún le falta el presupuesto suficiente para concretarse con el proyecto. Por el momento continuara trabajando para salir adelante. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alicia is an enterprising 35 year old woman who shares her life with one of her two sons, since he is older and independent. They live together in the house that she owns. For more than 5 years she has been earning a living selling candy in a school that is very well known in the area where she lives. She likes her work very much as it is calm and also gives her the opportunity to make friends. On the other hand, she also prepares stuffed potatoes, a dish that Peruvians enjoy a lot, and she sells this at a reasonable price so that the children can buy it as they leave school in the afternoon. As a result, she is very content with her business and hopes to have a food stall or a restaurant in the future, but she does not have sufficient budget to make the project real. For the moment, she will continue working in order to be a success. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be timely in her repayments. With the loan that she requests, she will buy a greater quantity of candy in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candy supplies in order to stock-up her business

loans.name: Luz Divina 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Nelly, 20, is the coordinator of her group Luz Divina (Divine Light), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her parents.

Nelly is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling sandals and beauty products, by purchasing shampoo, creams, and sandals to sell.

She will use the profits to pay for her university studies where she is studying to be a doctor.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, creams, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Todos los días desde las cuatro de la mañana, la señora Ana Julia llega al mercado Mayoreo con las naranjas dispuesta a venderlas todas y así obtener ingresos para el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su familia.

Ella es una dama muy trabajadora y anhela continuar en dicha labor para el mantenimiento de su hogar. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de dichas naranjas y así continuar en su labor.
texts.en:
Every day at four in the morning, la señora Ana Julia arrives at the Mayoreo market ready to sell all her oranges. Her sales generate income to improve her family's standard of living. She is a very hard-working woman and wishes to continue with this work to pay household expenses. This loan will be used to buy oranges for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oranges

loans.name: Mujeres De Deborah 3 Group

texts.en:
Luz, 60, is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Deborah (Women of Deborah), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with four dependents.

Luz is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado (general store) by purchasing rice, beans and canned goods to sell.

She will use the profits to repair the roof to her home.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Dios Nuestro Ayudador 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Suzette, 42, is the coordinator of her group Dios Nuestro Ayudador (God Our Helper), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and five children.

Suzette is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling shoes and clothes by purchasing more merchandise as well as creams to add to her business. She will use the profits to provide food for her five children and to save towards purchasing her own home.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and creams

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 31 años de edad, ella comparte su vida con su pareja e hijo. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 3 años se dedica a vender  productos de belleza y esto es gracias al consejo de una amiga, que la motivo a incursionar en la venta de cosméticos. Esta actividad le ha sido muy rentable, gracias al tiempo disponible que tiene para dedicarse a su negocio, es así que durante las mañanas realiza las labores del hogar, en donde recoge a su hijo del colegio y por las tardes se dedica íntegramente a su negocio. Rosa nunca pierde el tiempo su gran carisma le ayuda a ofrecer y ganarse la confianza de la gente, siempre lleva consigo sus catálogos por si alguna madre de un compañero de su hijo le hace algún pedido. En un futuro desea instalar un bazar. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos y tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old. She shares her life with her partner and son. They all live in their own home. She has been selling beauty products for more than 3 years, and she started doing this thanks to some advice from a friend who motivated her to get into cosmetics sales. This activity has been very profitable as a result of the time that she has available to dedicate to her business. She does her housework during the mornings and picks up her son from school, and in the afternoons she dedicates herself to her business. Rosa never wastes time, and her great charisma helps her to win people's confidence. She always carries her catalogs with her in case the mother of one of her son's schoolmates wants to place an order. In the future, she'd like to open a stall. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with her repayments. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy a large quantity of cosmetics to have in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of cosmetics to have in stock

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is an individual loan client with Esperanza and his story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. He is located in Puerto Plata, a northern port town where the economy is based around tourism and where running water (none of which is potable), and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long term partner and their three children.

Nelson is excited to be taking his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in running a small cafeteria by purchasing rice, cooking oil and other ingredients. He will use the profits to invest in his home by changing the walls from wood to cement block: a major improvement in the termite-infested and hurricane-prone DR.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La señora Juana Paula A. muy esforazadamente vende frutas y verduras en el Mercado Mayoreo buscando la manera de obtener los ingresos para el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su familia.

Ella se siente muy satisfecha porque ha logrado ir mejorando poco a poco en el negocio ya que desde muy temprano abre el tramo para iniciar sus ventas.

Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de futas y verduras para su comercialización y a la vez para la compra de los mamones para su respectiva comercialización.
texts.en:
Trying to improve her family's standard of living, la señora Juana Paula A. expends much effort selling fruits and vegetables in the Mayoreo market. She feels very satisfied because her business has slowly but surely grown. She opens her site very early to start her business day. She requests this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale and also to purchase mamones (a fruit similar to lychee) for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly de 38 años, comparte su vida en compañía de su esposo Germán de 40 años y sus hijas, Yoselin de18 años y Carolina de 11 años. Desde muy joven ella ha trabajado en diversos oficios para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que siempre le ha gustado sentirse útil e independiente. Desde entonces optó por vender variedad de productos y de acuerdo a la época del año. Como el caso del mes de Octubre, vende turrones (postre típico limeño), ropa y bebidas durante los fines de semana, por ser temporada de fiesta patronal central del país y casi toda la gente disfruta de esta fiesta. Pero la actividad a la que se dedica todos los días es a la venta de comida, es por ello que debe levantarse desde tempranas horas e ir al mercado y posteriormente preparar la variedad de platillos que día a día ofrece. Con el tiempo espera tener un negocio más fijo, pero por el momento se siente contenta con la actividad que realiza. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP por lo que asegura que siempre será muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar alimentos al por mayor para así economizar y lograr mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 38, lives in the company of her husband Germán, 40, and her daughters Yoselin, 18, and Carolina, 11. Since she was very young, Nelly has worked in various occupations to move her family forward, which has always made her feel useful and independent. Nelly has opted to sell a variety of products related to seasonal events. For example, on weekends in October, she sells turrones (a typical dessert of Lima), clothing, and drinks because this is the time of the patron saint festivals, which almost all families come out to enjoy. However, in her day-to-day business, Nelly runs a food stand. She must wake up early each morning, go to the market, and prepare the variety of dishes she will offer that day. In time, Nelly hopes to have a more established business, but at the moment she is content with her work. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she assures that she is always very punctual with her payments. With the credit that Nelly is requesting, she plans to buy food products wholesale so that she can reduce costs and earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food and products wholesale for the preparation of meals

loans.name: Carla Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La venta de ropa es la actividad a la que muy amablemente se dedica la señora Carla V. en el Mercado Mayoreo siendo este negocio el que se ha dedicado para levar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a sus hijos.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la ropa  a sus proveedores y así ofrecerla en el mercado. Espera ser beneficiada lo más pronto posible con el crédito para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Clothing sales in the wholesale market is what the friendly Mrs. Carla V. devotes herself to. This is the business she has chosen to maintain her home and provide for her children. She is requesting a loan to invest in purchase of clothing from her suppliers, to be offered on the market. She hopes to receive the loan as soon as possible in order to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, beans, oil, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Miurell Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Miurell Raquel M. L., es una joven de 22 años casada y su esposo labora como transportista,  apoyándole en los gastos que se incurren en el hogar, ella se trabaja como domestica en casas privadas desde hace 4 años.

Ellos son una familia de escasos recursos y uno de sus principales necesidades esta la remodelación de su vivienda, sobre todo que se acerca la temporada de lluvia, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan las edificaciones de un muro en su hogar, esta inversion le garantizara una mayor seguridad y las comodidades necesarias para habitar en un ambiente optimo y digno para todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Miurell is a 22-year old married woman. Her husband works as a truck driver, and to support the household's expenses, Miurell has been employed as a domestic worker in private homes for 4 years. They are a family of scarce resources and with the rainy season coming, one of their most pressing needs is to remodel their home. Therefore, the family solicits a loan for the purchase of construction materials to erect a new wall in their home. This investment will guarantee all of the members of Miurell's family more security and the comfort of living in a decent environment.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to remodel the home by adding a wall

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Josefa Antonia G. R., tiene la edad de 56 años habita con su compañero de vida y su hijo adolecente en el barrio Laureles norte, su esposo le apoya en los gastos y las tareas del hogar, el sustento de la señora  ha sido una pequeña venta de frijoles, cocidos, refrescos y tamales.

Desde hace 3 años ha tenido esta negocio, y en algunos meses del año  ha sentido una disminución en las ventas, fue con la ayuda de su esposo quien le brindo los recursos necesarios, para dar comienzo a la compra de la materia prima de las ventas,  a futuro desean poner una pulpería con la intención de incrementar sus ventas, por ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de laminas de zinc, con el fin de cambiar el techo de su casa, además de protegerlo de las temporadas de lluvia que en este mes afectan a las familias nicaragüenses por los fuertes chubascos.
texts.en:
Ms. Josefa Antonia G. R., age 56, lives with her husband and teenage son in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She and her husband both contribute to the household expenses and chores. Josefa's makes her livelihood by running a small store selling beans, stews, beverages, and tamales. Josefa has had her business for 3 years, and in some months of the year has seen a decline in sales. With the help of her husband, she has been able to obtain the necessary resources to start buying the ingredients necessary to make her products. In the future they hope to open a small store in order to increase sales. However, for now Josefa is requesting a loan to purchase zinc sheets to replace the roof of her home. The new roof will protect her family during the months of the rainy season, which affects Nicaraguan families with its heavy downpours.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials to replace roof

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Cuando usted visita a Andrea C., se da cuenta D. su gran dinamismo y empuje,  porque así como tiene una miscelánea donD. vendee juguetes, cremas para el cabello pinta uñas, ganchos D. cabeza, cintas papel D. regalo, etc. también se dedica a la venta D. deliciosas frituras y así mismo venD.  carbón y todo esto constituye su ingreso familiar, porque todo lo que se venda con disciplina produce dinero. Andrea vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena y tiene una hija ya D. 43 años, está separada y aun continua haciendo esfuerzos D. trabajo, con mucha alegría y con ganas. Inició su negocio con un crédito que le dio la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y gracias a éste  y a la capacitación recibida, fue organizándose y estructurando mejor su microempresa; ella al principio tenia solo su miscelánea, luego quiso tener mas ingresos y agregó el D. fabricar empanadas, arepas, y otras frituras, el cual trabaja en las mañanas muy temprano, y finalmente como es una persona conciente D. las oportunidades, se dio cuenta que vender carbón era otro buen negocio y lo adicionó también, aprovechando que alrededor D. su vivienda, se encuentran muchos negocios D. comidas rápidas y asaderos  que necesitan D. este producto para poder funcionar.
Andrea tiene 11 años D. estar vinculada a la Fundación, y con sus créditos ha podido salir adelante al lado D. su hija, a quien proporcionó estudios y ahora mismo la apoya en su negocio. Su meta siempre es trabajar, no solo para ser exitosa en su negocio, sino también  para quedar bien con los créditos y tener siempre las puertas abiertas y continuar atendiendo bien a su mamá que depenD. económicamente D. ella. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor D. $1.000.000 COP con el cual comprará carbón en buena cantidad porque en épocas D. lluvia se vuelve escaso, surtirá también su vitrina con mercancías cosméticas y D. miscelánea y “espera hacer rendir este dinerito
texts.en:
When you meet Andrea C., you realize that she has a great dynamism and drive. She has a business selling consumer products such as toys, hair creams, nail polish, hair adornments, tape, wrapping paper, etc. She also sells delicious fried foods and also coal. All of these activities proviD. her family with an income, because she sells everything in a disciplined manner with the objective of gaining income. Andrea lives in the city of Cartagena and has a 43 year-old daughter. She is separated and still makes an effort to work with joy and enthusiasm. She started her business with a loan that she was given from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and thanks to this and the training she received she was able to organize and restructure her small business. At first, she sold only miscellaneous goods. Later, since she wanted to have more income, she also began to make empanadas, arepa (a kind of corn griddle cake), and other fried foods, which she makes very early in the mornings. Finally, as she is a person who is aware of opportunities, she realized that selling coal was another good business, and she added that on as well, taking advantage of the fact that in the area around her home there are many fast food businesses and roasted meat sellers that need this product in order to operate. Andrea has been involved with the Fundación for 11 years. With her loans, she has been able to get ahead along with her daughter, who she was able to proviD. with an education and who now supports her in her business. Her goal is to always work, not only to be successful with the business, but also so that she can pay off the loans and always have her doors open. She also wants to continue to care for her mother who depends on her economically. She is currently applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000,000 Colombian pesos, with which she will buy coal in bulk, because in the rainy seasons it becomes scarce. She will also restock her glass display case with cosmetics and miscellaneous products, and she hopes to make this money go far.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cosmetics and hair adornments and also to invest in buying coal at wholesale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 47 años de edad, comparte su vida en compañía de sus hijos Wilson de 23 años y Carmen de 20 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Ella se dedicó desde muy joven al trabajo de la confección de prendas de vestir, en un principio en talleres donde le pegaban un sueldo fijo, ganando gran experiencia en esta labor, para posteriormente poner su propio taller en su casa donde hasta la actualidad se dedica a esta labor y con la cual saco adelante a sus hijos. Ella confecciona a pedido, pantalones Jean y de otros materiales, así mismo elabora blusas, hoy solo confecciona prendas en material polar por la temporada de invierno, en donde son enviados al interior del  país. Por la cantidad de pedidos que tiene pendiente, muchas veces su hija Carmen la ayuda en la elaboración de dichas prendas, ya que Teresa le enseñó a su hija esta labor, pero lo que más desea es que su hija estudie una profesión. En un futuro desea ampliar su taller, comprando máquinas y contratando personal, de esa manera consolidarse como una microempresaria. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará material para terminar de cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Teresa is 47 years old, and she shares her life in the company of her two children, Wilson, 23 years old, and Carmen, 20 years old. They live together in their own home. Since she was very young, Teresa has worked as a clothing-maker. At first she worked in workshops where she received a fixed salary. This work gave her excellent experience in this field, eventually enabling her to start her own clothes-making workshop in her home, where she continues to work today. Working from home enabled her to make dresses while also watching over her children. Teresa makes her clothing to order, making things like jeans and pants from other materials, as well as blouses. Lately she is only making clothes in warm fleece fabric on account of the cold winter weather. These clothes are often sent to the interior of the country. Depending on the amount of clothing orders she has waiting to be completed, her daughter Carmen will occasionally help her to make the clothes; although Teresa has passed her clothes-making knowledge on to her daughter, what Teresa wants most is for her to go to school to learn a profession. In the future Teresa hopes to expand her workshop, purchasing machines and hiring staff, and herself assuming the role of a businesswoman running her own small company. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she has always shown herself to be very responsible with her payments. With the loan that she requests, she will purchase material to complete the clothing orders that she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar material para continuar confeccionando prendas que tiene pendiente.

loans.name: Oscar Andrés

texts.es:
El señor Oscar C. es un caballero muy trabajador que se ha destacado por ser un buen padre de familia y una persona muy preocupado por el mantenimiento de su hogar.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de las frutas y verduras para su actividad sobresaliendo la compra de aguacates ya que los comercializará para obtener los ingresos y así mejorar sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar C. is a hardworking gentleman who stands out by being a good father to his family and a person who places great importance on the upkeep of his home. Currently he is asking for a loan to buy fruit and vegetables for his business, especially purchasing avocados that he will sell for the income and thus improve his economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Diana Esther

texts.es:
A Diana E.  su naturaleza creativa y emprendedora la premió, porque  hace 30 años aprendió ella sola a cortar y coser ropa para sus hijos y mientras sus vecinos admiraban sus costuras se fueron interesando en mandarle a elaborar vestidos a sus hijos y así fue como gradualmente fue creciendo, porque muchos D. ellos empezaron a hacerle pedidos para negociarlos, mientras ella perfeccionaba su arte y agregaba otras líneas como las D. damas y caballeros, que en la actualidad ofrece también. Ella cuenta que lleva cuatro créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con los que ha logrado capitalizarse, comprar nuevas máquinas D. coser y fileteadota  y con las utilidades D. su negocio ha logrado remodelar su casa, especialmente adecuando dos habitaciones para que sus hijos durmieran cómodamente. En la actualidad está aplicando por un monto D. $1.200.000 COP, para comprar telas adornos e insumos D. modistería y elaborar vestidos que tiene encargados.
Su meta principal es adecuar su taller en la parte baja D. su casa y hacer un gran taller D. confecciones que genere muchos puestos D. trabajo estables en especial para su hija, que es discapacitada del lenguaje a quien esta enseñando este hermoso y prospero arte.

 Diana  es muy feliz en la ciudad donD. vive: “Cartagena D. Indias” , tiene 5 hijos D. 27 a 40’ años D. edad, es una mujer, que aunque separada logró levantar su hogar con su negocio “Variedades Diana” donD. viste a hombres, mujeres y niños y cuida D. siempre mantengan una imagen adecuada a su estilo D. vida.
texts.en:
Diana E. is endowed with creativity and an enterprising spirit. Some thirty years ago, she taught herself to cut out and sew clothing for her children. As her neighbors admired her work, they started commissioning her to create clothes for their own children. Thus she grew, because many of her neighbors began to place orders to market them, as she improved her technique and added other lines, such as for ladies and men, which she currently offers. She states that she has had four loans with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she has invested in new sewing machines and trimming attachments. With the profit from her business, she has remodeled her home, in particular setting up two rooms for her children to sleep comfortably. Right now she is applying for $1,200,000 COP, to buy fabric, ornaments, and dressmaking supplies, and to complete garments ordered from her. Her main goal is to set up her shop in the lower section of her house, and have a large tailoring workshop generating many stable work sites, in particular for her daughter, who has a language disability, and to whom she is teaching this lovely, thriving profession. Diana is very happy where she lives, that is “Cartagena D. Indias.” She has five children, ranging in age from 27 to 40. Although separated, she is a woman who has built her home with her business, “Variedades Diana,” where she dresses men, women, and children, and takes care to offer an image appropriate to lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, ornaments, and dressmaking supplies, and make garments already ordered.

loans.name: Alcira Enna

texts.es:
Alcira Díaz  es una mujer D. estado civil viuda que  inició su negocio una vez su esposo falleció, e invirtió un capital en la compra D. mercancías muy económicas, teniendo en cuenta que su área D. acción está conformada por personas que no tienen mucha capacidad adquisitiva D. compra ; cuando esta estrategia empezó a darle resultados, una amiga la invito a buscar alternativas D. incrementar su capital D. trabajo en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donD.   encontró las puertas abiertas para hacer su primer crédito por valor D. $1.300.000 COP, que fue invertido en su negocio y le representó mayor cobertura D. clientes y por consiguiente mas ingresos. Hoy está aplicando a otro crédito por valor D.  $2.000.000 COP, con el que comprará jeans, toallas, camisetas y blusas solicitadas por los clientes que tiene en diversos barrios D. la ciudad D. Cartagena. Su meta es ampliar su cobertura en otros municipios del departamento D.  Bolívar, y es esta la razón por la que espera seguir siendo apoyada por la Fundación.
