Roxana lives with her parents and she is preparing to begin studying nursing at the university. Roxana sells salchipollos as a street vendor by the door of her grandmother's house. She has been doing this during the afternoon for 3 years. In addition, Roxana helps her father sell car parts; it is a family business. Roxana belongs to the Solidaridad communal bank and she needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in purchasing taillights car accessories. Roxana dreams of expanding her business and finishing her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase taillights and car accessories.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es soltera y vive con sus padres, estudia educación en la Universidad, Nelida vende ropa de mujeres hace 4 años, actividad que realiza 2 días de la semana en las ferias de Americas y Nazarenas, cuenta con la ayuda de su mama, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Nelida es socia Banco Comunal Solidaridad y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro. Nelida solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, buzos, blusas.
Los sueños de Nelida son ampliar su negocio, tener una tienda grande y estudiar la carrera de psicología.
texts.en:
Nelida is single and lives with her parents. She is studying education at the University. Nelida has sold women's clothing for 4 years, an activity that she carries out 2 days a week at the Americas and Nazarenas markets. Her mother helps her with the business, and she acquires her products in the city of Lima. Nelida is a member of the communal bank "Solidaridad." What she appreciates most is the training she receives, and the incentives she is given to save. Nelida requests a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of T-shirts, sweatshirts and blouses. Nelida dreams of expanding her business, having a large store and studying for a degree in psychology.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, sweatshirts and blouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He is going to use it to improve his house. He is going to put in a new floor in his house and has to buy flooring and cement.

loans.name: Alicia Fortunata

texts.es:
Alicia pertenece al Banco Comunal Solidaridad y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones que la distraen y relajan.
Alicia es casada y tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 3 estudian, Alicia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, pollo, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual D. sus hijos. Además Alicia hace artesanía en retablo junto a su hermano, sus productos los venD. D. acuerdo a los pedidos.
Alicia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.

Los sueños D. Alicia son que sus hijos estudien y ampliar el local D. su tienda.
texts.en:
Alicia belongs to the communal bank "Solidarity," and what she likes the most are the meetings that amuse and relax her. Alicia is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are in school. Alicia has a store in her home where she sells groceries, including vegetables and chicken. She works in the store every day with the occasional help of her children. In addition, Alicia, along with her brother, makes retablos (Andean folk art in the form of portable boxes which depict religious, historical, or everyday events that are important to the Indigenous people of the highlands of Peru and Bolivia), and sells them according to the orders that they have. Alicia needs a loan of 600 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and cooking oil. Alicia dreams of having her children receive an education, and of expanding the premises of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Félix Juan

texts.es:
Félix es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Yencala Boggiano, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, zona que tiene un moderado movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría aves de corral y animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan con frecuencia la zona. Esta actividad le provee de una fuente estable de ingresos con los cuales saca adelante a su joven familia. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero agrícola.

Félix desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado de modo que puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Félix es un padre bastante trabajador y que siempre vela por el desarrollo y bienestar de los suyos, su sueño es tener un terreno de cultivo con el cual percibir ingresos permanentes.
texts.en:
Felix is a 23 year-old father who lives with his wife and their children in the Yencala Boggiano neighborhood, a rural area in the Lambayeque district. This area has a moderate level of commerce, and belongs to the province of the same name. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For 4 years he has been raising and selling animals. He raises barnyard fowl and small animals at the back of his house. When they have reached an adequate level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who visit his area frequently. This activity provides him with a stable source of income, with which he can provide for his young family. He also works as a farmhand. Felix wants to improve the raising of his animals by acquiring nutritionally balanced feed, so he can get a better price for them. To achieve this objective he has seen the need to request, for the first time, a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles. Felix is a hardworking father who always ensures that his family members have what they need for their development and well-being. His dream is to have land to cultivate so that he could have permanently higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed so that he can improve his business of raising small animals for sale

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines es socia del Bancomunal Ccori Soncco, es madre de 2 hijos, la mayor tiene 14 años y el segundo 3 años y medio. Ines se dedica a la venta de cachipas (quesos artesanales) en el mercado Nery García de Huamanga,  desde hace 3 años ella se siente muy contenta por que tiene muy buena venta, ya que sus clientes le compran constantemente por ello menciona que no tiene ninguna dificultad en su negocio.
El préstamo que esta solicitando lo va ha invertir para la compra de cachipa al por mayor.
El sueño de Ines es poder construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ines agradece a Finca Perú   porque gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió a invertir correctamente el dinero que le prestan.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the communal bank "Ccori Soncco." She is the mother of 2 children: the oldest is 14 years old and the youngest is 3 and a half years old. Ines has sold cachipas (artisanal cheese) in the Nery García market in Huamanga for 3 years. She feels very content because she has good sales, since her customers buy from her constantly. For this reason, she mentions that she is not having any difficulties with her business. She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy cachipa at wholesale. Ines dreams of being able to build her own house and of seeing her children become professionals. Ines appreciates Finca Perú, because thanks to the training she learned how to correctly invest the money that they loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cachipa (cheese) at wholesale

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera, y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Punto Cuatro, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito agrícola de Mochumí, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más dos años tiene instalada en su casa una pequeña bodega donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes a sus clientes. Este negocio le provee los ingresos suficientes para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia que solo percibe ingresos de la agricultura

El negocio es de mucha ayuda a su comunidad ya que les provee los artículos que necesitan diariamente, el sector donde viven está alejado de la ciudad de Mochumí y para abastecerse usualmente tienen que viajar hasta el mercado de la ciudad.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la zompra de mas productos de primeranecesidad y abarrotes de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias que le permitan salir adelante y seguir apoyando a sus padres, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María es una joven bastante trabajadora y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con el fondo Kiva y gracias a su ayuda pudo ampliar un poco mas su negocio, con lo cual sus ventas y clientes aumentaron
texts.en:
María is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the hamlet of Punto Cuatro, a rural area that is part of the agricultural district of Mochumí, which in turn is in Lambayeque province. Her town is located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than two years she has had a small store in her house where she offers basic necessaries and groceries to her customers. This business gives her enough income to cover her personal expenses and help her family, which only sees income from farming. Her business is a big help to her community, since it provides them with things they need day-to-day. The area in which they live is far from the city of Mochumí, and usually to get the basics they have to travel to the market in the city. María wants to increase her business with the purchase of more necessaries and groceries so she can increase her sales and income, allowing her to improve her life and continue helping her parents. For this purpose, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles. María is a hard-working and responsible young woman. In the past she has already worked with Kiva and thanks to its help she was able to grow her business, allowing her to increase her sales and clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of necessaries and groceries to grow a store in her home

location.town: Anexo La Piedra - Caserío Punto Cuatro - Mochumí -

loans.name: Javier Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr.  Javier Antonio H. P., El trabaja como Gerente General en el Mercado Israel Lewite de Managua.
Es padre  de familia  de un hijo  y este  se encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para  utilizarlo en gasto de medicamento de un familiar que esta enfermo.

Javier Antonio  dice que gracias a los financiamientos  otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier Antonio H. P. works as the general manager of the Israel Lewite Market in Managua. He is married with a school-age son. He is asking for the loan to buy medication for a relative that is sick. Javier Antonio says that thanks to the loan from CEPRODEL he has been able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medication for a sick relative

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa P. es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive en la comunidad de Nero un poco apartada de la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y muchos salen a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Nuestra socia tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 3 hijos quienes se encuentran de 12, 8 y 7 años de edad y todos se encuentran estudiando en una escuela de la comunidad, su esposo es de profesión albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a la venta de frutas y granos los días feria que son miércoles, sábados y domingo, el resto de días se dedica a la cría de animales como: chanchos, cuyes, gallinas.

Se encuentra en su quinto ciclo realizando los  créditos en la fundación Espoir, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando más granos y frutas para la venta. Su meta es  seguir creciendo en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos para que en el futuro tengan una profesión.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa P. is a member of the communal bank Narancay Bajo. She lives in the Nero community not far from the city of Cuenca where the people are farmers and many look for work outside of the city.

She is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children whose ages are 12, 8, and 7 and who study in a school located within the community. Her husband is a construction worker and through their marital work have built ther own house.

Mrs. Rosa sells fruits and grains on market days which are Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. The rest of the week she raises pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.

As of now she is in her fifth loan cycle and repaying the loans for the Espoir Foundation. Her new loan will be used to buy more grains and fruits to sell. Her goal is to continue growing her business and give her children a good education so that they can have jobs in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas, apples, watermelons, melons, beans, lentils, etc.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Bancomunal ccori soncco, tiene 63 años, es madre de dos hijos, la mayor 42 años y la última de 18 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, huevo, leche, aceite, fideos, harina, ace, betun, Champú, gaseosa, agua mineral, etc) vende desde hace 15 años, los sábados vende pescado y los  domingos vende mondongo y tiene mucha clientela  
El préstamo que esta solicitando lo va ha invertir en la compra de azúcar, arroz, ace , betún, huevo, gaseosa, harina)
Maura no tiene ninguna dificultad en su negocio porque sus clientes son constantes en la compra de sus productos. 
el sueño de Maura es poder construir el segundo piso de su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Agradece la capacitaciones que ha recibido porque son buenas, porque pone en práctica todo lo aprendido en su negocio y en su familia.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Ccori Soncco communal bank. She is 63 years old, with two children: the eldest is 42, the other 18. She sells groceries (rice, sugar, eggs, milk, oil, pasta, flour, detergent, shoe polish, shampoo, soda, mineral water, etc.), which she has been doing for 15 years. On Saturdays she sells cooked fish, and on Sundays she sells mondongo. She has a large clientele. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy sugar, rice, detergent, shoe polish, eggs, soda, flour, etc. Maura does not have any problems with her business, since her clients are consistent in their purchases of her products. Maura's dream is to be able to add a second story to her house and for her children to become professionals. She is thankful for the training she has received as it has been good, and she has put into practice everything she has learned with her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada 20 minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante ha hecho que se dedique a la venta ambulante de comida en un carrito especialmente diseñado para esta actividad. Empezó viendiendo hamburguesas y salchipollos en la puerta de su casa y actualmente ha decidido instalar su puesto de venta en los exteriores del mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque, los platos que prepara tienen mucha acogida, debido a la buena sazón con la que los prepara.

Rosa prepara los alimentos con la mayor salubridad posible, ya que es consciente de la responsabilidad que conlleva preparar estos alimentos. Actualmente ella desea adquirir mas insumos para preparar más comida, lo cual le permitirá satisfacer la demanda de su nueva zona de trabajo, para esto ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora, responsable y muy entregada a su familia. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con el fondo Kiva y gracias a esta ayuda pudo trasladar su negocio de la puerta de su vivienda a donde vende actualmente. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus pequeños hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior con la que se aseguren un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, separated, and is caring for two children. She lives with her family in the city of Lambayeque, which is located 20 minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. In order to get her children ahead, she works as a street vendor, selling food from a cart which has been specially designed for that purpose. She started out selling hamburgers and salchipollos [fried potatoes with shredded chicken and hot-dogs] in front of her house, but has now decided to setup her business outside the Lambayeque city market. All of her foods are very well received by her customers, owing to the delicious seasoning with which she prepares them. Rosa is quite aware of her responsibilities when preparing food, and does so in the most sanitary manner possible. She would now like to acquire some additional equipment so that she can prepare more food, and thereby satisfy the demand of her customers at her new location. For this reason she has requested a loan of 2000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Rosa is extremely hard working, responsible, and dedicated to her family. She has previously worked with Kiva, and thanks to this previous help, she was able to move her business from the front of her house into its current location. Her biggest wish is to give her little ones the opportunity to study a good career, so they can enjoy a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of ingredients and equipment  used for the preparation of hamburgers and salchipollos.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.es:
Betsy es socia del bancomunal Ccori Soncco, tiene 27 años, es madre de 3 hijos, el primero tiene 10 años, el segundo 8 años y la ultima 1 año ½, Betsy trabaja en una imprenta junto a su esposo desde hace 10 años; en la imprenta hay diversas máquinas que realizan todo tipo de impresión.
El préstamo que esta solicitando Betsy lo va ha invertir enla compra de papel bond y tinta para la impresora.
El sueño de Betsy es poder mejorar su local y comprar más materiales de impresión, también quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Betsy is a member of the communal bank "Ccori Soncco." She is 27 years old, and is the mother of 3 children: the oldest is 10, the middle child is 8, and the youngest is 1 1/2 years old. Betsy has worked in a printing house with her husband for 10 years; in the printing house there are different machines that do all types of printing. The loan that Betsy is requesting will be invested in the purchase of bond paper and ink for printing. Betsy dreams of improving her business premises and buying more printing materials. She would also like to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more printing materials

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es:
Ana es socia del bancomunal Ccori Soncco, tiene 32 años, es madre de 3 hijos, el mayor tiene 13 años, la segunda 6 años y el último 8 meses, se dedica a la elaboración de panes, Ana lo elabora en la panadería de sus padres, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres desde que tenia 10 años de edad.
El préstamo que esta solicitando Ana lo va ha invertir en la compra de harina, huevo, levadura, mantequilla, manteca, aceite y azúcar.
La dificultad que tiene en su negocio es la competencia, pero se siente contenta porque eso le impulsa  a mejorar la calidad de sus panes.
El sueño de Ana es poder tener su propia panadería en su casa, pero para ello necesita más capital por eso esta ahorrando y se siente muy contenta por que su dinero se esta incrementando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the communal bank "Ccori Soncco." She is 32 years old and is the mother of 3 children: the oldest is 13, the middle child is 6, and the youngest is 8 months old. She has a business making bread. Ana makes bread in her parents bakery. She learned this trade from her parents from the time that she was 10 years old. Ana is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of flour, eggs, yeast, butter, lard, cooking oil and sugar. The main difficulty she faces in her business is the competition, but she feels content because this motivates her to improve the quality of her bread. Ana dreams of having her own bakery in her home, but to do this she needs more capital, and she is saving up for this. She is pleased because her savings are growing little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, eggs, yeast, butter, and other supplies to make bread

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive en la comunidad de Rumiloma a unos 20 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y muchos salen a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Nuestra señora es socia hace cinco ciclos en la fundación Espoir siendo incentivada a ingresar a la banca comunal por su mamá, se dedica a vender frutas en el mercado, actividad que la realiza hace 10 años los días miércoles, sábado y domingo, también fue incentivada por su mamá para que realice este trabajo el cual le ayudado para mejorar la economía de su hogar.

La Señora Rosa tiene 32 años de edad es casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 3 hijos quienes se encuentran de 12, 8 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo este año ingresa al colegio y su segunda hija estudia en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión  albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más fruta para así seguir ampliando su negocio. Su sueño es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Narancay Bajo." She lives in the Rumiloma community, which is 20 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca. Here the people work in agriculture, and many leave for the city in search of better work opportunities. Rosa has been a member of the Fundación Espoir for 5 loan cycles. She was encouraged to join the communal bank by her mother. She works selling fruit in the market, an activity that she has been carrying out for 10 years on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays. Her mother encouraged her to do this work so that it would improve the finances of her household. Rosa is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 12, 8 and 3 years old. Her oldest son entered high school this year, and her second daughter studies in a school in the city. Her husband is a bricklayer. They are living in a rented home, as they do not own a home of their own. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of more fruit so that she can continue to expand her business. Her dream is to eventually have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, melons, bananas, coconuts, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa es socia del bancomunal Ccori Soncco, tiene 27 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, la mayor tiene 3 años y la segunda es pequeñita tiene 2 semanas de nacida.
Carmen Rosa tiene una tienda donde vende productos para regalos como son peluches, relojes, cuadros, porta fotos, globos y flores.
La dificultad que tuvo fue cuando comenzó su negocio los 2 primeros meses no tenia mucha venta, pero ella fue persistente  y desde el tercer mes empezó a vender más. el prestamo que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de productos para su tienda.
Carmen Rosa menciona que desde que esta en FINCA ella es más puntual y mas organizada en sus quehaceres. su sueño es poder construir su casa y tener un local propio para poder vender y así obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Ccori Soncco" [which means "Heart of Gold" in Quechua]. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her older daughter is 3 years old and the second is very young, born just two weeks ago. Carmen Rosa has a business where she sells gift items like stuffed animals, watches, pictures, photo frames, balloons, and flowers. She had some difficulty when she started her business, as she did not make many sales in the first two months. However, she was persistent and since the third month she has started to sell more. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase products for her store. Carmen Rosa mentioned that since she joined FINCA, she is more punctual and organized with her tasks. Her dream is to be able to build herself a house and to have her own store to sell from, and to thereby increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to sell at her gift store

loans.name: Rocio Erika

texts.es:
Rocio es socia del bancomunal Ccori Soncco, tiene 22 años, es soltera, ella se dedica a la impresión y estampados en la imprenta de su tío. El préstamo que esta solicitando lo va ha invertir para la compra de tintas, papel, fotolitos para poder realizar estampados, porque las ganancia de estampados es para ella.
Rocío menciona que gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido es mas puntual y mas organizada en el trabajo.
El suño de Rocío es tener su propia imprenta, también poder viajar a otro país para poder buscar nuevas oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
Rocio is a member of the Ccori Soncco community bank. She is 22 years old and single. She is dedicated to printing and stamping at her uncle's print shop. The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of ink, paper and films so she may create her stamps since the earnings from stamping are for her. Rocio mentions that, thanks to the training that she has received, she is more punctual and more organized at her job. Rocio's dream is to have her own print shop and also to be able to travel to another country in order to be able to look for new living opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ink, paper and film.

loans.name: Mayra Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Mayra A. es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca siendo reconocida  por su arquitectura, sus iglesias, los 4 ríos que la bañan, su gastronomía y su gente que es muy amable.

Nuestra socia se dedica a  su tienda la cual tiene dos años y trabaja en ella desde las 7 a.m. hasta 9 a.m., también tiene un gabinete de belleza hace 3 años  en el labora de lunes a sábados, aprendió esta actividad ya  que ha seguido varios cursos.

Nuestra socia tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño que tiene 1 año de edad, sus padres son comerciantes y vive en casa de ellos que es propia.

 Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo,  realizando los créditos en la fundación Espoir,  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir  en la compra de víveres para su tienda. Su sueño es  tener un gabinete de belleza más grande.
texts.en:
Mayra A. is a member of the Narancay Bajo Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its architecture, its churches, the four rives that flow through it, its cuisine, and its very friendly people. Our member devotes herself to her store, which she has had for two years. She works in it from seven a.m. until nine a.m. She has also had a beauty parlor for three years. She works there from Monday through Saturday. She learned this business from several courses that she took. Our member is 19 years old. She is a single mother, and she has a one year old child. Her parents are merchants. She lives in their house, which is their own. She is in her second cycle of loans with the Espoir foundation. She will use the new loan to buy supplies for her store. Her dream is to have a larger beauty parlor.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, sugar, eggs, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el distrito agrícola D. Nueva Arica, una zona D. terreno bastante accidentado, dada su cercanía a la sierra norte del país. Se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar criando y vendiendo animales desD. hace mas D. diez años, ella cría animales menores en su vivienda y cuando estos ya han alcanzado su máximo nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta los días martes en una feria que se instala en la ciudad D. Cayaltí. 

Consuelo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la elimentación D. sus animales D. modo que pueda venderlos a un mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Consuelo es una mujer traajadora y responsable, en la zona sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona D. trato amable y que ayuda a los que la necesitan
texts.en:
Consuelo is 56 years old, married and lives alongsiD. her husband and three children in the agricultural district of Nueva Arica, a quite hilly area of land, thanks to its proximity to the northern mountains of the country. She is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has been dedicated to the work of raising and selling animals for more than ten years. She raises young animals in her house and when they have reached their maximum level of development, she sells them on Tuesdays in a market in the city of Cayalti. Conseulo wishes to acquire balanced feed to improve her animals' nutrition so she can sell them at a better price. To achieve her objective she has requested for the first time a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Consuelo is a hard-working and responsible woman. In her area, her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be an amiable person who helps those in need.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed to improve the growth of her animals that she sells.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es:
Lelis tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, una zona de terreno bastante accidentado, dada su cercanía a la sierra norte del país. Se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar criando y vendiendo animales desde hace mas de diez años, ella cría animales menores en su vivienda y cuando estos ya han alcanzado su máximo nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta los días martes en una feria que se instala en la ciudad de Cayaltí. Ella no sólo vende los animales que cría sino que también recorre los caseríos cercanos comprando animales a los lugareños.

Lelis desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas animales y alimento balanceado para poder venderlos a un mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Lelis es una mujer luchadora y que trabaja incansablemente por el bienestar de su familia. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para apoyar a su esposo con el sostenimiento del hogar.
texts.en:
Lelis is 43 years old, is married and lives alongside her husband and her young son in the farming district of Nueva Arica, a quite hilly area of land due to its proximity to the northern mountains in the country. She is located one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has been dedicated to the work of raising and selling animals for more than ten years. She raises young animals in her house and when they have reached their maximum level of development, she sells them on Tuesdays in a market in the city of Cayalti. She not only sells the animals that she raises but also she goes through nearby villages buying animals from the villagers. Lelis wishes to expand her business acquiring more animals and balanced feed in order to be able to sell them at a better price. To achieve her objective, she has requested, for the first time, a loan of 1,200 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Lelis is a fighter and a woman who works tirelessly for the well-being of her family. The income that she receives are used to support her husband with the bills.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed to grown her business raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector La Viña, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde a trabajar desde hace quince años en labores asociadas a la agricultura: por un lado cría vacas en un terreno cercano a su vivienda y comercializa la leche que extrae entre los vecinos de la zona y por otro lado posee un terreno de cultivo en el cual suele sembrar diversos granos, con estas actividades el sustenta los gastos de su familia y trata de sacarlos adelante.

Actualmente Leonardo ha sembrado maíz y se encuentra cuidando de su cultivo para que este le brinde una buena producción que le depare suficientes ganancias para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sacarlos adelante. El desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Leonardo es un padre responsable y que siempre ha trabajado para sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos le consideran una persona honrada.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a father who is 42 years old and lives alongside his wife and his three children in the sector of La Viña, a rural area in the agricultural district of Nueva Arica, an area located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He has been working for fifteen years in jobs related to farming. On the one hand, he raises cattle on land close to his house and sells the milk that he extracts to his neighbors in the area. On the other hand, he owns farming land where he usually sows various grains. With this work, he supports his family and tries to get ahead. Currently, Leonardo has planted maize and finds himself taking care of his crop so it provides a good production and enough earnings to be able to improve his family's quality of life and get them ahead. He wishes to acquire fertilizers to maintain his crops. For this reason, he has requested, for the first time. a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help him achieve his objective. Leonardo is a responsible father who has always worked to get his family ahead. In the area where he lives, his neighbors consider him to be an honorable person.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to maintain her maize crop.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel es un padre de familia de 48 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona que ha experimentado un creciente movimiento comercial en los ultimos años, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace mas de tres años fabricando puertas y mostradores de aluminio en un pequeño taller ubicado en el distrito donde vive. Este negocio cuenta con mucha acogida ya que en la zona hay pocos talleres de este tipo. Sus principales clientes son los comerciantes que necesitan de estos mostradores para exhibir sus productos y el público en general. Este negocio es su principal fuente de sustento con la que trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a los suyos.

Victor Manuel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas material como aluminio y vidrios con los cuales pueda aumentar su producción y percibir mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El es una persona bastante conocioda y respetada en la zona donde vive. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is a 48 year-old father. He lives with his wife and their two children in the agricultural district of Cayaltí, which is an area that has experienced a growing commercial movement in recent years. It is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. Victor has worked for over three years making aluminum doors and counters in a small workshop located in the district where he lives. This business was well-received because there were few workshops of this type in the area. His principal customers are merchants who need counters to show their products, as well as the general public. This business is his main source of livelihood and he works hard to help his family get ahead. Victor Manuel hopes to develop his business by purchasing more materials like aluminum and glass, with which he will be able to augment his production and earn more income. In order to achieve his goal, he has requested a loan (of 2000 nuevos soles) from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. He is a quite well-known and respected person in the area where he lives. His greatest dream is to provide his family with the quality of life they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aluminum and glass to expand his door and counter-making business

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Culpón del distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona que ha experimentado un moderado crecimiento comercial en los ultimos años, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace mas de diez años, el cría animales menores en su domicilio y los vende a los negociantes que visitanla zona para adquirirlos y revenderlos en la ciudad de Cayaltí y en Chiclayo. Adicionalmente cuenta con un campo de cultivo donde siembre todo tipo de granos y también trabaja como obrero en la empresa agroindustrial del lugar.

Actualmente ha sembrado maíz en su terreno de cultivo y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para que esta siembra le brinde una buena producción, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes con los cuales brindará mantenimiento a su maíz.

Sergio es un padre que trabaja incansablemente por el bienestar de su familia. El se esfuerza diariamente para sacarlos adelante y darles la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Sergio is 55 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children in the Cayaltí agricultural district in the Culpón sector, an area that has experienced a moderate growth in business in recent years. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For more than ten years he has worked jobs associated with agriculture. He raises small animals at home and sells them to dealers that come to the area looking to buy them and then resell them in Cayaltí and Chiclayo. In addition, he has a field where he plants and cultivates all types of grains. He also works as a laborer at an agribusiness company in the area. At the present time he has corn planted in his field and is working hard to insure a good harvest. For this reason he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for 1200 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency). He plans to buy fertilizer for his corn. Sergio is a father that works untiringly for the well-being of his family. He strives daily to provide for them and to give them the quality of life that they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to help insure a good corn harvest

loans.name: Betty Consuelo

texts.es:
Betty es una madre D. familia D. 55 años D. edad que vive junto al ultimo D. sus tres hijos, es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya independizados. ResiD. en el distrito D. Chepén, un distrito agrícola situado en la provincia del mismo nommbre, ubicado en la región La Libertad, a una hora D. distancia D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. diez años a la venta D. carne D. pollo en un puesto ubicado en el interior del mercado D. su distrito, ella trabaja diariamente para atender la demanda D. sus clientes y para sacar adelante a su familia. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro se ha hecho muy conocida y tiene un grupo D. clientes fijos.

Betty desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas carne D. pollo para venderla a sus clientes y D. esa manera aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer luchadora, ha sabido salir adelante a pesar D. haberse quedado sola. Sus vecinos y compañeros D. trabajo le tienen mucha confianza y respeto.
texts.en:
Betty is 55 years old and a mother of three children. Betty is widowed and lives with her oldest child. Her other children are now independent. She lives in the district of Chepen, an agricultural area in the region of La Libertad, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 10 years Betty has worked selling chickens from a stand insiD. the central market of the district. She works every day to meet the demands of her customers and help her family's quality of life. Thanks to the many years she's been working in this place, she has become well known and has a steady group of customers.

Betty would like to grow her business by purchasing more chickens and increasing her sales, so she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternative to help her reach her goal. Betty is a fighter, and she learned how to get by and take care of her family after being left on her own. Her neighbors and co workers have a lot of confidence and respect for Betty.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase more chickens to continue growing her business

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:

Arsenia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arsenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. Arsenia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

With the Kshs. 40,000 he wants to purchase a bundle of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. High transport costs were cited as his major challenge in  business.


Hassan hopes to own a wholesale shop in future. He decided to work with Yehu because it is simple to join and offers accessibility to sustainable financial services. 


He owns a house with no electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.name: Nani Chori

texts.en:
Mrs. Nani Chori D. lives in Chappagaun Village. Chappagaun village is located in Lalitpur district. Chappagaun is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in vegetable farming.


Mrs. Nani Chori D. lives with her husband and two children. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying at university and her daughter is studying at higher secondary school.


Both Mrs. D. amd Mr. Desar are engaged in vegetable farming. They own a piece of land where they grow green, seasonal vegetable. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening every day.


Mrs. D. is requesting a Rs 30000.00 loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for their vegetable farm.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has been operating her tailoring business for over twenty years. She is married with six adult children. Her husband also helps in the running of the tailoring business. She sells from her shop to neighbors, passersby and people on their way to school. She owns rental houses which contribute to her income.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase one sewing machine and material. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality, especially during the month of April when school children are on holiday. She hopes that someday she will run a wholesale shop.


Rehema decided to join Yehu because it is simple and offers sustainable financial services. She owns a home with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity.

loans.use: To purchase one sewing machine and material.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married with six children: two have finished school and four are still going to school. She has been operating her firewood and charcoal business for three years and sells from her home to her neighbors. 


With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to buy a bundle of firewood and two sacks of charcoal. Mejumaa's other source of income is her husband's earnings.


The major challenges in her business are the high cost of transportation and theft. In the future, she hopes to run a wholesale shop and to increase her profits.


She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.  Mejumaa owns a home with electricity but no piped water. Her major challenge is food.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of charcoal and a bundle of firewood.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:

With the Kshs. 30,000, she wants to purchase a bundle of maize flour, wheat flour and a sack of rice. Seasonality and theft are her major challenges. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to expand her business.

Sharifa hopes to run a hotel in the future. She rents a house with electricity and no piped water. Food and electricity bills are her great expenses.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of maize flour,wheat flour and a sack of rice.
