loans.use: Achat de sorgho,haricot,...pour les vendre en détail

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Marie D. est une fille de 32 ans qui habite a la cite des forces armées une des cites environnantes de la banlieue de Dalifort. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis 4 ans et a déjà rembourse 2 prêts  antérieurs. C’est une fille qui aime elle-même gagner sa vie raison pour laquelle depuis 3 ans elle s’active dans le secteur du petit  commerce et de la petite restauration. C’est une vendeuse  ambulante de fruits qui commercialise oranges, bananes, pommes, qu’elle se procure au marche Sandaga. En ce qui concerne la petite restauration  c’est une activité  qu’elle a hérité  de sa petite  sœur. Elle a récupéré  sa place et y   vend le déjeuner. Son souhait est de toujours développer son commerce et c’est la raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs destine a l’achat d’un réfrigérateur  ou elle pourra conserver  au frais les restants de fruits. Ce sera aussi l’occasion pour elle de s’adonner a la préparation de thiakry  qu’elle pourra vendre le soir. Pour mademoiselle D. l’accroissement de ses bénéfices  lui permet de renforcer son épargne, de mieux respecter ses engagements vis-à-vis des tontines, et aussi d’acquérir  des bijoux en or.
texts.en:
Miss Marie D. is 32 years old and lives in the housing development of the armed forces, one of the housing developments in the suburb of Dalifort. She has been a member of the credit union for 4 years and has already repaid 2 previous loans. She is the type of girl who likes to earn a living for herself, which is why she has spent the past 3 years running her own food stall and working in a food outlet. She is a mobile fruit vendor who sells oranges, bananas and apples that she procures from the Sandaga market. She also works in a food outlet, where she took over from her younger sister selling lunches. Her wish is to continue developing her business. She is therefore requesting a loan of 200 000 frs to buy a fridge in order to store her left over fruit and keep it fresh. It will also give her the opportunity to devote her time to preparing Thiakry (sweetened snack/dessert made from grain and fermented milk) which she will be able to sell in the evening. For Miss D., the growth of her profits will allow her to improve her savings, to better respect her commitments in regard to the tontines, and also to acquire gold jewellery.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investissement

loans.name: Bernardina Santos

texts.es:
Bernardina  tiene 33 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es madre soltera y tienes una hija que se llama Nicolasa de 12 años de edad y cursa el quinto grado escolar, se dedica a la venta de frutas.
Ella vende frutas  picada y embolsada, su venta es ambulante la coloca en los alrededores del centro de la ciudad de San Miguel, Bernardina necesita el préstamo para comprar al mayoreo fruta(mango, piña, sandia, papaya, jocotes) y adquirirla a un precio bajo, así obtener ganancia, esto  contribuira a mantener el negocio y solventar las necesidades basicas pasa su familia. Bernardina es una persona que sueña con mejorar los ingresos de su negocio para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su pequeña hija que desea asistir a la universidad.
texts.en:
Bernardina is 33 years old and is a single mother to Nicolasa, her 12 year old daughter who attends school. Bernardina sells fruit and fruit snacks around the city of San Miguel. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit (mango, pineapple, watermelon, papaya) at wholesale prices, increasing her profits and helping to cover her family's basic needs. Bernardina dreams of increasing her income so that she can provide a better quality of life for her daughter, who hopes to attend university.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit - mango, pineapple, watermelon, papaya - at wholesale prices so that she can increase her profits

loans.name: Mbaye Mbacke

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye Mbacke  Gringue  est  un jeune tailleur de 30 ans qui habite dans la localité de Dara Salam à  Dalifort. Il est père d’un enfant de 2 ans et  est sociétaire  de la caisse depuis 4 ans. Le choix de son activité se justifie par le fait qu’il l’a hérité de son père qui était un grand tailleur très  connu. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat d’une machine à coudre afin d’améliorer  sa productivité. Par conséquent  son financement pourra lui permettre de faire face à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mr. Mbaye Mbacke Gringue, aged 30, is a young tailor who lives in the town of Dara Salam in Dalifort.  He is a father of a 2-year-old child and has been an associate of the branch office for four years.  His choice of business is explained by the fact that he inherited it from his father, who was a great tailor and well-known.  Mr. Gringue is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buy a sewing machine in order to improve his productivity.  Consequently, his financing will enable him to cope with the burgeoning demand from his customers. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Julia Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Julia es madre de dos hijos, tiene la edad de 31 años, casada, su negocio es una pulpería que lleva varios años trabajando para lograr ayudar a su familia, entre las dificultades que esta pasando es que su esposo esta desempleado.
Lo cual la esta apoyando en la venta en despachar los productos. Al inicio que comencé lo hice con la iniciativa de obtener dinero para lograr dar lo necesario a los niños, ya que todo ha incrementado, lo que ha venido hacer de gran ayuda ahora que solo están dependiendo de su negocio. Lo que espera que su esposo pronto logre ubicarse en otro empleo y lograr poder equilibrar los gastos.
Con este financiamiento lograra invertir en más producto para la venta en compra de quintales de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, aceite, caja de jabón, soya, alimentos en carne, pollo, huevo, queso leche. Que es lo que mas se vende y desea lograr aumentar las ventas para poder lograr pagar los gastos.
texts.en:
Ms. Julia is the mother of two children. She is 31 years old and married. Her business is a small grocery store where she has worked for several years in order to help her family. Among the difficulties she is facing is the fact that her husband is currently unemployed. Now he is just helping her to sell products in their store. At the beginning, when she started her business, her aim was to earn some money to provide for the needs of her children. Her business has grown, so it has been a huge help now that her family is depending on her business alone. She hopes that her husband will be able to find another job soon and they will be able to balance their expenses. With this loan, she will invest in more products to sell. She will buy quintales [a quintal is a weight measure equivalent to 46 kilograms] of rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil, boxes of soap, soy beans, meat, chicken, eggs, cheese, and milk. These are the products she sells the most of and she hopes to increase her sales in order to be able to pay her family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, boxes of soap, soy, meat, chicken, and other products to increase her sales

loans.name: Tuzamurane Isangano Group

texts.fr:
François H. est âgée de 39 ans, il est marié avec 4enfants, le grand a 13ans et le petit a 2ans.François est président du  groupe appelé Tuzamurane Isangano, ce groupe travail en commun pour l’expansion de leur business diversifié dont tous font le commerce, il travail six jours la semaine ils sont aussi agri-eleveurs car ils vivent dans un milieu rural. François est vendeur des produits alimentaires qui sont sorgho, haricots avec expérience de 5ans.

François et son groupe travail pour augmenter la capacité financière de leur groupe. En fait, le groupe a contracté n prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles pour ravitailler leur business.les bénéfices récoltés après vente de ses produits sont réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour le bon future la troisieme partie du profit de leur business est epargné au compte du groupe.

Concernant le groupe
Un prêt de groupe signifie que chaque membre prend son montant et l’utiliser pour son propre business, l’avantage est que le groupe garantisse pour les prêts individuels de chaque membre et si un membre ne parvient pas rembourser, tout les membres du groupe remboursent a sa place
texts.en:
François H., 39, is married with four children. The oldest is 13 and the youngest 2 years old. François is the president of the group called Tuzamurane Isangano, which is working together to expand their various businesses. All of them are merchants. They work six days a week and they are also farmers and livestock-raisers since they live in a rural area. François sells foodstuffs such as sorghum and beans and he has five years' experience. François and his group are working to grow their financial capacity. In fact, they have taken out this loan from Amasezerano Community Banking to buy goods to bolster their business inventories. The profit they expect to make after selling this merchandise will be reinvested so as to maintain the financial stability of the group and used to put aside savings so as to be able to afford a better future. One-third of their business profit is put into savings in the group's account. Concerning the group A group loan signifies that each member takes his share and uses it for his own business. The advantage is that the group guarantees the individual loans of each member and if the member is not able to reimburse his loan, all the members of the group will reimburse it in his name.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 sacks of sorghum and 2 sacks of beans

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es:
La señora Balvina S. R., es casada y su esposo le apoya en los gastos que se incurren en las labores diarias del hogar, ella es una mujer humile que se dedica al comercio desde hace muchos años atras el cual a sido la fuente dxe ingresos que le ha brindado el sustento diario a sus hijos.

Es para su negocio, que solicita u prestamo para la compra de granos basicos y de eta manera surtir su abarroteria, esta inversion le permitira mejores condiciones economicas que favorezca a sus niveles de vida y la posibilidad de poder ofrecerle a sus hijos un ambiente mas digno y seguro debido a que el lugar donde habitan reporta altos indices de delincencia que amenaza a sus pobladores.
texts.en:
Mrs. Balvina S. R. is married and her husband helps her with the costs that they incur in daily home life. She is a humble woman who has been working in commerce for many years, which has been the source of income that has supported the sustenance of her children. She requests a loan for the purchase of basic grains to stock up on her groceries. This investment with enable better economic conditions that will increase their quality of life and allow her to be able to offer her children a more dignified and safe way of life. The environment in which they live has high crime and delinquency rates that threaten the local population.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains

loans.name: Alione Fandiere

texts.fr: Monsieur Alioune Fandiere S. est un vulgarisateur   de 41 ans qui habite à Yeumbeul  Nord  dans les environs du quartier de Baye Laye. Mais il est en même  temps transporteur depuis plusieurs années. Chacune de ses activités  a sa période  de rentabilité. Pendant la période  de chaleur c’est la vulgarisation qui marche fort alors que pendant la période  de vacance le secteur du transport connaît un ralentissement de ses activités. Il  est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis février 2007. Il sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu  pour réparer  un de ses véhicules  en panne. Ce financement pourra ainsi l’aider a accroitre ses bénéfices, a régulariser  ses revenus, a  mieux gérer sa famille et ses problèmes  personnels et aussi  a renforcer son épargne.Monsieur S. est marie,pere de 3 enfants et a aussi 3 autres parents a sa charge.
texts.en:
Mr Alioune Fandiere S. is a 41-year-old extension worker living in Yeumbeul Nord, close to the Baye Laye neighbourhood. He has also worked in the transportation field for several years. Each of his activities has its own earning season. During the warm season extension work is very busy while the transportation field slows down for vacations. He is a member of the Baye Laye credit institution since February 2007. He seeks 500 000 francs in order to repair a broken down vehicle. This loan could also help him increase his profit, steady his revenue, better manage his family and his problems and boost his savings. Mr S. is a married father of three, with three other family members in his care.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: refection vehicule

loans.name: Pape Mass

texts.fr: Monsieur Pape Mass F. habite a la cite sones, une cite  située  non loin de la localité de Baye Laye a Guediawaye. Il est membre de la caisse depuis février  2010. Il pratique l’activité de maçon. Mais il vend en même  temps des briques et des produits alimentaires. Il loue aussi des bois de coffrage et des futs pour eau. C’est un chef de famille qui doit gagner sa vie et gérer  une famille et c’est la raison pour laquelle il cumule toutes ces activités. Il sollicite un crédit  de 200 000 frs pour renforcer son stock de briques prévues  pour la vente. Son objectif étant  de maximiser ses gains, ceci lui permettra de mieux gérer  les besoins de sa famille et constituer une épargne   pour gérer  les imprévus.
texts.en:
Mr. Pape Mass F. lives in the Sones neighborhood, a neighborhood situated not far from the Baye Laye district, a part of Guediawaye. He is a member of the bank since February, 2010. He is a mason by trade. But, at the same time, he sells bricks and food products. He also rents out timber formwork and drums for water. He is the head of a family who must earn his keep and manage his family's needs, and that is why he has so many different business activities. He has taken out a loan of 200,000 Francs to enhance his stock of bricks in order to sell them. His objective is to maximize his profits, which will allow him to better meet his family's needs and save for unexpected needs that may arise.

Translated from French by Kathy Guis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Madame Rokhaya D. est une femme mariée  de 40 ans qui évolue  depuis longtemps dans la vente de petit déjeuner  à Guediawaye. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par passion et aussi dans le souci de gagner sa vie et éviter de rester les mains croisées. Les moments les plus rentables de  son activité coïncidente ave l’année scolaire. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs dans le but de développer  son activité. Madame D. s’est  fixé  2 objectifs qui sont de  prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de se  constituer une épargne  pour mieux gérer  l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mrs Rokhaya D. is a 40-year-old married woman who has long been selling breakfasts in Guediawaye. It is a business she chose by taste, as well as to earn a living and avoid idleness. The most profitable periods for her business are during the school year. She requests a 100 000 francs loan so as to expand her business. Mrs D. set two goals for herself: take charge of her own needs and build savings to better deal with the future.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase funds

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Santa Rosa de Curvan del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo de frutas, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales para agenciarse de ingresos. El cría ovejas en establos ubicados cerca a su vivienda y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitanel lugar para adquirir animales y revenderlos en diversos puntos del norte del paíz. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el sustenta la economía de su familia.

José desea adquirir alimento para su ganado de modo que puedan desarrollarse de mejor manera y sean vendidos a un mejor precio, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

José es un padre que siempre trabaja buscando el bienestar de su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Jose is 67 years old, married and lives with his family in Santa Rosa de Curvan in the district of Tambogrande, an area known primarily for cultivating fruit. It is part of the province of Piura and is located about 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque.

Jose raises and sells sheep for a living. The stables are located close to his house, and when the animals are old enough, he sells them to the people who visit the region to purchase animals which they then sell in various locations in the north of the country. With the income he earns, Jose has been able to support his family.

Jose would like to purchase top quality feed for his animals, to help with their development and secure a better price when he sells them. He is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternative to help him achieve his objective.

Jose is the kind of father who has always worked for the well being of his family. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and acquaintances consider Jose to be a kind and trustworthy person.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high quality feed for the sheep he raises and sells.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita es una joven madre de familia, tiene 20 años de edad y vive junto a su menor hija, su esposo trabaja en el puerto de Paita. Ellas residen en el caserío El Porvenir del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito cuya principal actividad es el cultivo de frutas. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Anita desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Anita es una mujer activa, distribuye su tiempo entre el cuidado de su familia y en su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen nos muestra las boletas de pedido que recibe de la empresa que le provee de productos.
texts.en:
Anita is a young mother who is 20 years of age and lives with her young daughter and her husband who works at the port of Paita. They reside in the village of El Porvenir in the district of Tambogrande where the main business activity is fruit production. This district lies in the province and region of Piura and is located more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Anita sells beauty products and cosmetics through catalogs. She has a group of customers who buy products from her frequently. As she gets more orders, she receives more points from the company that provides her with products and is able to generate more revenue. For this reason, she strives every time to gain more customers.

Anita wants to have a stable source of capital so that she can acquire more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics so that she make them available to customers who need them immediately and cannot wait up to a month to receive their orders. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 400 PEN to help her continue with her goal.

Anita is an active woman who divides her time between caring for her family and her work. Her greatest wish is to see her family have a better quality of life. In the photograph, she is holding up the order forms that she receives from the company that provides her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Ngoune

texts.fr: Madame Ngoune L.  est une femme de 55 ans qui habite à Daroukhane à Guediawaye. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis novembre 2009. Elle est marie, mère  de 5 enfants et a en charge 5 autres personnes. Elle a choisi l’activité  de vente de crème  glacée  et pagnes par passion. Son souci majeur est d’aider son mari dans la gestion de la famille. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs pour renforcer son activité  car en période  de chaleur la demande augmente fortement. L’accroissement de ses  profits lui permettra de prévoir  les frais de scolarité  de ses enfants a travers la renforcement de ses activités.
texts.en:
Mrs Ngoune L. is a 55-year-old woman living in Daroukhane, Guediawaye. She is a member of the Baye Laye credit institution since November 2009. She is married, has five children and takes care of five other people. She chose to sell ice cream and pagnes (colourful West African cloth) by taste. Her main concern is to help her husband manage the family. She asks for a 100 000 francs loan in order to build her business, as demand increases greatly during the warm season. The increase in her profits will allow her to plan for her children's tuition by expanding her activities.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building capital

loans.name: María Yesenia

texts.es:
María Yesenia tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, el distrito con la mayor extensión geográfica de la región, está conformado por un pueblo central y varios caserío que distan mucho uno del otro, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de alquiler de cabinas de internet (café internet) desde hace mas de dos años, adicionalmente brinda otros servicios asociados como tipeos, impresiones y copias. El negocio es bastante frecuentado por los jóvenes y estudiantes de la zona que siempre acuden a buscar información para realizar sus trabajos escolares. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y en apoyar a sus padres en el sostenimiento de su familia.

María desea brindar mantenimiento a sus máquinas para que estas puedan seguir funcionando de modo correcto, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer responsable y que trata de ayudar a sus padres en el sostenimiento y cuidado de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es abrir otras cabinas de internet en su distrito.
texts.en:
María Yesenia is 33 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the district of Olmos, which is the largest in the region in terms of geography. The district consists of a central town and several villages that are distant from one another. It is situated in the province of Lambayeque and located an hour and 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been managing an Internet café for more than two years. She also provides other services such as typing, printing, and copying. Her business is frequented by young people and students in the area who are always looking for information to complete their homework. The income she earns from this business is used to cover her personal expenses and help her parents with supporting their family.

María wants to provide maintenance for her machines so that they continue to function properly. In order to do this, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

María is a very responsible woman who tries to help her parents with supporting and caring for their family. Her greatest wish is to open another Internet café in her district.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for computer maintenance

loans.name: Ndeye Diouma

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ndeye Diouma N. est une habitante de Baye Laye. Elle est âgée  de 35 ans. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis octobre 2008. Elle s’adonne  depuis longtemps  à la vente de petit déjeuner  devant son domicile. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par passion  et aussi dans le but de s’occuper. Ses moments les plus favorables pour son activité  sont l’année  scolaire et les dimanches. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  car elle souhaite démarrer  une activité  de vente de thioup  afin de diversifier son commerce. Les  gains réalisés  seront consacres a soutenir sa famille et a constituer une épargne.
texts.en:
Miss Ndeye Diouma N. lives in Baye Laye. She is 35 years old. She is a member of the credit institution since October 2008. She has been selling breakfast in front of her home for a long time, a business she chose by taste and to keep busy. The best times for her business are during the school year and on Sundays. She asks for a 100,000 francs loan because she wishes to start up a thioup selling business so as to diversify her trade. She will use the profits to sustain her family and build up savings.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements & pay for household expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials to build a room for one of his children

loans.name: Zakhida

texts.en:
Zakhida O. is a 35-year-old woman who raises calves in the small village of Saatli. She has more than 10 years experience. She buys calves in the livestock bazaar every three month, fattens them and sells to the local butchers for a profitable price. Her income is not permanent as she earns money once every 3-4 months and makes about 2000 AZN.  

Zakhida is married and has three children. She applied for a loan to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata S. habite à Kip coco,  une zone située  non loin de la localité de Baye Laye  Guediawaye. Elle évolue  pendant  longtemps dans le commerce bien qu’elle soit aussi couturière  de profession. Elle s’active surtout dans la vente de pain et  de patte d’arachide. Elle a choisi cette activité  par passion et surtout pour gagner sa vie afin de pouvoir soutenir financièrement  sa famille. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 400 000 destine a bien renforcer son stock de pate d’arachide qui sera bien vendu durant l’hivernage. L’accroissement de ses gains lui facilitera la gestion de ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de ses enfants et petits fils. Elle souhaite aussi renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata S. lives in Kip Coco, an area located not far from the town of Baye Laye Guediawaye. She has been involved in trade for a long time, although she is also a trained seamstress. She is especially active in the sale of bread and peanut butter. She chose this activity out of passion and above all to earn a living in order to support her family financially. She is requesting a loan of 400,000 in order to build up her peanut butter supplies that she will sell easily during the winter season. The increase in profits will help her manage her personal needs as well as her children's and grand-children's needs. She also wishes to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the floor of his house

loans.name: Amil

texts.en: Amil I. is 30-year-old man who rents a small butcher shop and has been selling meat there since 2008. He keeps sheep and also purchases cattle and sheep for his shop. Amid is married and has three children.  He has had a previous loan from AqroInvest and proved himself a trustworthy client. Now he has applied for 900 AZN to purchase more cattle to fatten and sell, and also to improve his animal keeping conditions. He believes, one day, he will be able to build his own butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and improve his animal keeping conditions.

loans.name: Mbissane

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbissane N. est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis avril 2009. C’est un marié,  père  de 3 enfants en plus de 3 autres personnes dont il assure la charge. Monsieur N. est responsable d’un groupe scolaire de la localité. Compte tenu de l’insuffisance  des revenus qu’il gagne comparés  à ses charges il mène  une activité  d’élevage  en embauche bovine. Pendant les cérémonies  de mariage, de baptême, et autres événements  tels que la Korite, la tabaski ou certaines fêtes  religieuses  la demande est très  forte. A cet effet il sollicite un crédit  de 300 000 frs qui sera destine a l’achat de bœufs prévus  pour la vente. L’accroissement de ses revenus lui permettra de mieux gérer  ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. Mbissane N. is an associate of the Baye Laye branch office since April 2009.  He is married and the father of three children, plus he has three other people to support.  Mr. N. is the head of a school group in town.  Given that he does not earn enough compared to his expenses, he has a business raising and fattening cattle.  During weddings, baptisms, and other events, such as Korite, Tabaski, or certain religious festivals, the demand is quite strong.  To that effect, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs that will be used for buying steers to sell. The growth in his revenues will enable him to manage his family responsibilities better. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Nail

texts.en: Nail M. is a 24-year-old man who has been selling food in Imishli city since 2001. He is single and runs his business to generate income and to financially support his parents. Nail's monthly income is about 600 AZN and he would like to increase it to 1000. For this reason, he applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more merchandise for his shop. Nail has already had a loan from KIVA through AqroInvest and repaid it successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to increase his income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es: La Sra. L. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa nueva para damas y caballeros done tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este oficio el que le ha permitido salir adelante con su esposo e hija y con el que están haciendo el esfuerzo de construir su pequeña casa de habitación. Tiene cinco años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado ocho créditos para invertirlo en su negocio y en la compra de un predio donde están empezando a construir su casa de habitación. El crédito fue solicitado para la compra de ladrillos, zinc, cemento y arena con el fin de terminar de construir su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Sra. Maricruz L. is originally from the town of El Sauce. Her business involves selling new clothing for women and men. Maricruz has been in this business for six years and it has allowed her and family to get ahead. She and her husband are making the effort to build a small house.

Maricruz has been working with CEPRODEL for five years and she has received eight loans that were used for her business and to purchase property on which she can begin the construction of her house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bricks, zinc, cement, and sand in order to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bricks, zinc, cement, and sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata D. est mère  de 2 enfants avec deux autres personnes a sa charge. Elle habite à Nimzhat  Guediawaye. Elle est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis novembre 2004. Elle est couturière  de profession et gère  son propre atelier de couture. Elle a choisi ce métier  par vocation. Durant  la  période  des fêtes  religieuses et chrétiennes  son activité  marche très  fort. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs pour renforcer  son activité, augmenter la rentabilité de son activité.  Elle compte sur ses revenus pour assurer la scolarité  de ses 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Aminata D. had two children and has two other dependants. She lives in Nimzhat Guediawaye and is a member of the Baye Laye credit institution since november 2004. She is a professional seamstress and manages her own sewing workshop. She chose this trade by calling. During the religious and Christian holidays, her business is very active. She sollicits a 150,000 francs loan to build her business and increase her profits. She is counting on her revenues to pay for her two children's schooling.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replace the floor of his house

loans.name: Mbadji

texts.fr: Madame Mbadji   G. est âgée  de 54 ans et habite dans le quartier de Baye Laye Guediawaye. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis janvier 2001. Elle évolue  dans le secteur du commerce. Elle s’est adonne pendant 6 ans à la vente de café. Mais actuellement elle s’est orientée  vers le poisson, less legumes  et les chaussures. Elle le fait par passion et aussi dans le but d’éviter  l’oisiveté. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 50 000 frs, montant avec lequel elle compte acheter des chaussures locales qui seront destines a la vente. Son objectif est d’améliorer ses gains pour soutenir son mari et aussi gérer ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Madame Mbadji G. is 54 years old and lives in the Baye Laye Guediawaye quarter; she has been a member of the credit association since January 2001. Over the past few years she has been developing her business activities, starting 6 years ago with coffee sales. Now, she sells fish, vegetables and shoes, both for love of her work and to avoid idleness. She is seeking a 50 000 FRS loan in order to purchase local shoes to sell. Her ultimate aim is to improve her profits in order to support her husband and to see to her own needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her business funds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a fast food cart

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Madame  Binta  B.  habite a Whakhinane   Guediawaye. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis septembre 2008. Elle est vendeuse de divers produits tels que l’huile  de palme, la  pate d’arachide qu’elle  vend par placement dans son quartier. Elle vend aussi du petit déjeuner. Madame B.  s’est adonne à cette activité  de commerce pour atteindre un certain développement  social. Elle sollicite un crédit  de  50 000 frs pour renforcer  les produits qu’elle commercialise. Son intention est de rechercher des bénéfices  plus consistants afin de pouvoir contribuer à la gestion  des charges familiales  dans son foyer.
texts.en:
Madame Binta B. lives in Whakhinane, Guediawaye. She has been a member of the Baye Laye credit association since September 2008. She sells various products such as palm oil, peanut paste and breakfast, through mobile sales in her quarter. She began in this business in order to develop socially, and is seeking a 50 000 FRS loan to boost her business proposition. She aims to generate more consistent profits in order to better satisfy her family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her business funds

loans.name: Eseta

Eseta needs a loan of WST$1000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Eseta joined SPBD and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Eseta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii andTonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers.

loans.name: Mereane

texts.en:
Mereane S. is 55 years-old and married with six children.  She is starting a business selling wood handicrafts to tourists and the local community.  Mereane needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional handicrafts to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Mereane joined Kiva partner SPBD and this is her first loan with them.   SPBD's loans are Mereane's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii andTonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana T. is 47 years-old and married with two children.  She owns a business raising chickens for sale.  Susana has three years of experience in this business.  Susana needs a loan of WST $1,500 to build shelter for her livestock.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 560 talas or US $233 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Susana joined Kiva partner SPBD and this is her second loan with them. SPBD's loans are Susana's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii andTonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To build shelter for her livestock.

loans.name: Zamier Group

texts.en: Sultan Bibi is the leader of Zameir Group. She lives in District 1 in the city of Jalalabad. She is 60 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a business making quilts. Currently her husband has some financial problems; therefore, she wants to take out a loan to purchase some rolls of cloth, cotton and thread to sew quilts to sell to receive a good income in order to support her husband and children. She would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders for their effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to purchase some rolls of cloth, cotton and thread to sew quilts

loans.name: Mohammad Ibrar

texts.en: Mohammad Ibrar, son of Shamsuldin, lives in Behsood District. He is 28 years old and married with 3 children. His farmland is not fertile. He wants to take out a loan to repair his land and purchase good quality seeds and mineral fertilizer to support his family and make his children's future bright. He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders for their helpful loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy timber and other essential materials for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for his son’s wedding expenses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase car parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en: Elvin S. is a 26-year-old man who works as a barber in Imishli city. He started his business in 2009 and since that time has gained respect among local men as he is very good with men's haircuts. He applied for a loan of 900 AZN so he can purchase new tools and improve his working conditions. He dreams of building his own barber shop one day.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and improve his working conditions

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar Q. is a 38-year-old trader who has sold different kinds of goods in a rented store for the last four years. A hard financial situation and unemployment pushed him to start his own business. His monthly income is 400 AZN and he is working very hard to increase it. He is married and has two sons. Bakhtiyar has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more goods and expand the number of products he sells in his store.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim I. is a young entrepreneur aged 24 who sells phone accessories in a rented shop in Imishli city. Ibrahim is married and has a daughter. He started his business in 2008 and has been very successful as his income is now about 300 AZN.  He pays quite high rent and he dreams of increasing his income and opening his own shop so he has applied for a loan of 800 AZN.

loans.use: To increase his income

loans.name: Khalilova

texts.en: Khalilova Y. is a 50-year-old woman who sells men's clothes in a small village of Agsu city. She started her business in 2010 and her monthly profit is already 150-200 AZN. She is very successful in her business as she has very good taste in choosing men's clothes. She is married and has six children. Y. started her business because she went on a pension in 2009 and lost her only source of income. She believes that one day she could build her own shop.

loans.use: To purchase new seasonal men's clothes

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham J. is a 38-year-old man who has sold confectionery and cookies in his own shop since 2009. He is married and has two children. His monthly income is about 500 AZN and he wishes to increase it to 700 AZN in the next six months. He applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase more merchandise and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and expand his business

loans.name: Sakhlar

texts.en: Sakhlar B. is a 53-year-old pension trader who has 10 years' experience in food sales. He is married and has four children. He started his business because he lost his job and wasn’t able to cover the basic needs of his dearest children. Sakhlar's monthly income is about 400 AZN. He is an experienced businessman and he wishes to open a new shop. To achieve his dream, he needs more money and for this purpose he has applied for a loan of 900 AZN. He needs this loan to purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Bayram

texts.en: Bayram R. is a 59-year-old man who sells different kinds of food in Agsu city. He is married and has three children. Keeping a big family is not an easy job and Bayram is doing his best to cover all his family's needs. Bayram spends 30% of his monthly income which is about 250 AZN to pay his rent.  He wishes to increase his income using this new loan and to make some savings to build his own shop one day.

loans.use: To increase his income

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal A. is a 31-year-old man who sells different kinds of beverages in a small village of Agsu city. Kamal has four years of experience in this field. His monthly income is about 250 AZN. He is married and has two sons. Kamal needs a loan of 1000 AZN so he can open a clothes shop besides the beverage shop which he currently has. Kamal says that the clothes business is profitable and will bring a stable income.

loans.use: To open a clothes shop

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inició la Señora Elba M.  del Barrio Romancito  de  Ciudad del Este. Ella Contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su comunidad.
El comité se Denomina”El Manantial  “están en el Séptimo  Ciclo   con 18  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias  y responsable entre ellas , las mismas poseen un ahorro  grupal para cualquier necesidad.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Daniela quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, ella realiza esta actividad desde hace un buen tiempo en un salón comercial que alquila en la ciudad donde vive.
En el local cuenta con todo tipo de mercaderías relacionadas a ropas modernas, para damas, caballeros y niños.
Ella comenta en esta actividad hay altibajos ya que hay días con mucha venta y otros sin ninguna ninguna, pero ella este trabajo es muy importante ya qua la ha ayudado en varias ocasiones cuando la familia necesitaba dinero.
Nos ayuda especialmente en la alimentación diaria que es los mas importante, y en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de nuevas mercaderías para su ropería como camperas, buzos, pantalón, y otras prendas de vestir para la temporada fría.
texts.en:
This group was organized by Ms. Elba M., who lives in the Romancito neighborhood of Ciudad del Este. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form this group in their community. The group is called "El Manantial." They are in their seventh loan cycle. [To see some of El Manantial's previous loans on Kiva, click here.] El Manantial has 18 members. They are well known in their neighborhood for being a very close-knit, supportive, and responsible group. They keep a group savings fund for whatever need might come up. One of the members is Ms. Daniela, who sells clothing from a commercial space she rents in the city where she lives. She has been doing this for a good amount of time. In her store, you'll find all types of merchandise relating to modern clothes for women, men, and children. Daniela commented that there are ups and downs in her line of work, since some days she sells a lot and others she sells nothing. For her, this work is very important, as she has been able to help on several occasions when her family has needed money. She also said her income has helped in particular to pay for their daily nutrition, which the most important thing. Currently, Daniela is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise for her clothing store, such as jackets, overalls, pants, and other clothing for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pants, jackets, t-shirts, etc. for women, men, and children (to improve her sales)

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando H. is from the town of Niño. He is 58 years old. Rolando is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rolando owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Aside from that, he also grows hogs for fattening and sale. Rolando has been engaged in his business for over 26 years.

Rolando joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rolando has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rolando is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Rolando from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients, but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Ninfa Amaye,  contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se Denomina “Kuña Guapa” están en el Décimo Segundo Ciclo   con  15 integrantes con sus respectivas actividades productivas. 
La señora Gladis es una de las integrantes quien se dedica a la venta de golosinas y empanadas de toda clase de pollo, jamón y queso, choclo, mexicana, chilena y otros. 
Ella prepara todos los días estos comestibles y los vende a varios obreros de fabricas que se encuentran instaladas cerca de su casa,
Con la venta de empanadas y golosinas ella obtiene ingreso diario que es muy importante para ayudar a su familia con la manutención del hogar especialmente para la alimentación y educación de la familia. 
Ella solicita asi como todas sus amigas del comité el crédito para invertirlo en la actividad que realiza todos los días, desea compra ingredientes para la empanadas como: carne de vaca y pollo, choclos, condimentos, aceites, y golosinas como dulces, galletitas, caramelos, alfajores, y otros.
texts.en:
The formation of this group was initiated by Señora Ninfa Amaye by inviting her neighbors and friends in the area to join. The group is called "Kuña Guapa". The 15 members are in their twelfth cycle. Each of them has a productive job. Señora Gladis is one of the members who sells sweets and all kinds of Mexican and Chilean empanadas (turnovers) filled with chicken, ham and cheese, corn and other things. Everyday she prepares these dishes to sell to the various factory workers near her house. The sale of empanadas and sweets provides her with a daily income that is very important as it helps with her family's household expenses, especially food and education. Señora Gladis, as well as all of her friends in the group, are requesting a loan to invest in her business. She wants to buy ingredients like chicken and beef, corn, condiments and oil for her empanadas and sweets like candy, cookies, caramels, alfajores (filled cookies) and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her empanadas that she sells as well as sweets.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
La  formación de este comité inició mediante la invitación de laa señora Felicita F., quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina “Kuña Pora” y se encuentran desarrollando el el Quinto Ciclo, con 11  integrantes. 
Es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario  y responsable. Las integrantes tienen actividades diferentes y siempre están con un gran espíritu emprendedor.
Todas las señoras son de familias humildes quienes luchan día a día para salir adelante, es por eso que las actividades que cada una realiza dependen de la facilidad con que cuentan, así la señora Teófila se dedica  a la venta de remedios yuyos o naturales.
Ella sale hacia el campo con sus hijos para recolectar todo tipo de remedios naturales que la gente consume para combatir cualquier dolencia.
Una ves que ella cuenta con la cantidad y variedad requerida por sus clientes, para mejor manejo y mayor ganancia empaqueta en bolsitas de diferentes tamaños para venderlos.
De esta forma ella trabaja y ayuda a su familia, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales en gran cantidad, y además para compra bolsitas de plásticos de diferentes tamoños.
texts.en:
The committee is called ‘Kuña Pora’ and its 11 members are now in their fifth loan cycle. Their group stands out in their community for being very unified, supportive and responsible. Its members are involved in different areas of work and they always carry out their work with an enterprising spirit. All of the women come from humble families who fight to get ahead on a daily basis, and the work they carry out depends on their particular abilities. One of their members, Teófila, works selling natural herbal remedies. She goes out to the country with her children to collect many different types of natural remedies that people can use to ward off pain. Once she has the amount and the variety that her clients need, she packs the herbs in small bags of different sizes. By packaging the herbs individually, Teófila’s clients will be able to manage their intake better and she will make a larger profit. In this way Teófila is able to work and support her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase natural remedies in bulk and to purchase small plastic bags of different sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural remedies in bulk, polythene bags and thread for packaging

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural H. is a 30 year-old man who runs his own café in Agsu city. He started his business only a year ago and despite this his café has become very popular because of the good quality service. Tural`s monthly income is 250-300 AZN. 

Tural bought this place and he is now ready to renovate it. He has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN in order to improve his working place. Tural is working very hard to meet the needs of his two children.

loans.use: To renovate his cafe.

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq M. is a 36 year-old farmer who grows pomegranates and seasonal fruits and vegetables. He started his business in 2000 and now has permanent clients who are local traders and restaurants. His monthly income is about 180-250 AZN. 

Sadiq is married and has three children. He lives and works in the small village of Agsu. Due to a good climate, this region has very good planting conditions which gives rich crops. Sadiq has applied for a loan of 1m000 AZN in order to purchase new varieties of fruit. His dream is to one day have a big fruit garden and become a rich person.

loans.use: To purchase new varieties of fruit trees.

loans.name: Sahiba

texts.en:
Sahiba A. is a 49-year-old entrepreneur who owns a beauty salon. She likes her job and started her business as soon as she had enough savings to open her own salon. Sahiba used to work in a general salon as a hair stylist but now she is independent and her monthly income is about 400 AZN. 

Sahiba's beauty salon is very popular because she is very quality specialist. She has about 15-20 clients a day, for hair cuts, hair coloring and styling. Brides are especially good for income as their styling is quite expensive. 

Sahiba is married and has three children. She has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase new tools and make renovations in her beauty salon.

loans.use: purchase new tools and renovations at her salon

loans.name: Huseynova

texts.en:
Huseynova S. is a 34-year-old breadmaker. She has a special furnace for bread in which bread cooks very fast and tastes very good. The bread making is a very profitable business, and S. can make 50-60 loaves of bread in one morning. 

She usually prepares dough at night so it can be ready by 5 a.m. Early in the morning she starts making bread, and by 10 a.m. it usually is finished. Her permanent clients are local people, cafes and nearby shops. Her monthly income is about 250 AZN. 

S. is married and taking care of two kids. This business is only one source of income in her family. S. applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to build  another furnace for making more bread as it is in very high demand.

loans.use: To build another furnace

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil Q. is a 33-year-old businessman who sells different kinds of goods, including men's clothes and underwear, electronics and home products, such as dishes. He is married and has three children. 

Adil recently started his business, but his store already brings him a stable monthly income of 500-600 AZN. Adil's shop is the sort of shop where you can get anything you need for home — that’s why he always has a lot of customers. The goods he sells are in very high demand among the local people. 

Adil applied for a 700 AZN loan to increase and diversify the number of products he sells. His dream is to build another shop like this in another part of the city.

loans.use: purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal J. is a 29-year-old trader who sells different kinds of goods, such as candies, tea, cookies, pasta, shampoo, detergent and soap. Vusal has four years of experience in this field. He is married and has two children. 

Vusal runs his own store, which he built a year ago owing to his hard work and ability to save money. His monthly income is 400 AZN and he wishes to increase it to 700 AZN. For this purpose, he has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to increase number of products he sells. 

Vusal wishes to build another, bigger shop as soon he can save enough. He believes the new loan will bring well-being to his two children.

loans.use: purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Khalis

texts.en:
Khalis M. is a 35-year-old cattle breeder who has 13 years of experience in this field. He is married and has three children. Khalis keeps cattle for meat, which he sells to the local butchers and cafés for meat, and also raises cows for milk and milk products, which is also very popular among local people. 

Khalis makes yogurt, which is in very high demand and his monthly income is about 250-300 AZN. He usually purchases small calves and raises them, fattening them so they sell for more profitable price. He applied for a 800 AZN loan to purchase more calves and increase his number of cattle.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Agashukur

texts.en:
Agashukur S. is a 54-year-old farmer who has bred sheep for the last seven years. He is married and has five children. Agashukur purchases lambs, fattens them and then sells them for profitable prices. His main customers are café keepers and local restaurants. His monthly income is 300 AZN. 

Sheep breeding requires a lot of physical effort, and Agashukur spends all the day in open air since early morning till late night. Now he has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase 10 sheep and approach his dream of a big farm with hundreds of sheep.

loans.use: purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: 03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hoa L. T. (43) is a 57 year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa- Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa).

Hoa is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To making a living, Hoa harvests and sells wild-caught fish in the local community. Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 500000 VND a month.

In 2005, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women which she used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting her 4th loan, for 4248000 VND, which she will use to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. L. T. Dai (6) is a 56 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. L. T. Oanh (113) is a 28 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2442600 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

3. N. T. Huyen (3) is a 53 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

4. N. T. Tiep (115) is a 33 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2442600 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

5. T. T. Thoa (61) is a 45 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3079800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Hoa L. T. (43) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa- Thanh Hoa. Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa (03.06.33- Hoang Thanh-Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 500,000 VND. Vào 2005, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Dai (6) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. L. T. Oanh (113) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2442600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. N. T. Huyen (3) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. N. T. Tiep (115) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2442600 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. T. T. Thoa (61) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Citali Group

texts.es:
ESTE  GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA CITLALI Y SIGNIFICA LUCERO ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN, MORELOS, MEXICO, ESTA FORMADO POR 6 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN Y SON VECINO LOS INVITO LA SRA. EMELIA  Y ESTUBIERON DE ACUERDO EN SOLICITAR EL CREDITO NO. 1 CON FUNDACION REALIDAD.

EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES LA SEÑORA ADELA B. R., TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 3º. GRADO DE SUCUNDARIA Y TIENE 4 HIJOS, 3 HOMBRES Y 1 MUJER, CESAR TIENE 19 AÑOS, SOLEDAD 14 AÑOS, FRANCISCO 12 Y ALEXIS TIENE 6 AÑOS. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA VENTA DE BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS, SU CREDITO LO QUIERE PARA COMPRAR BLUSAS Y SERVILLETA, INICIO ESTE NEGOCIO HACE 6 AÑOS POR NECECIDADES ECONOMICAS Y PARA QUE SUS NIÑOS FUERAN A LA ESCUELA, SU TIO LE HACE LAS BLUSAS TEJIDAS A GANCHO DE ESTAMBRE Y LAS SERVILLETA, VENDE LA MERCANCIA EN SU COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN LAS VA OFRECIENDO DE CASA EN CASA Y SI LAS TERMINA, SU HIJA LE AYUDA A COBRARLES A LOS CLIENTES QUE LE QUEDAN A DEBER. EL NEGOCIO HA AYUDADO A SU FAMILIA EN LA ALIMENTACION Y GASTOS DE LA ESCUELA DE SUS HIJOS, CON LAS GANACIAS COMPRA MAS BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS. ELLA DESEA HACER SU COCINA YA QUE TIENE UNA PROVISIONAL SOLO CON UN TECHO ESPERA LOGRARLO VENDINDO MAS BLUSAS Y SERVILLETAS. 
EN SU COMUNIDAD DE HUEYAPAN EL CLIMA ES FRESCO, HAY MUCHAS FRUTAS PERAS, CAPULINES, DURAZNOS, CIRUELA, HAY MUCHA VEGETACION, ÁRBOLES, PINOS Y FLORES MUY BONITAS, TAMBIEN HAY MUCHOS ANIMALES BORREGOS, CHIVOS, ETC. 
LA SRA. ADELA B. R. LES DA LAS GRACIAS A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD POR ABERME PRESTADO Y CONFIARON EN MI, ESPERO NO QUEDAR MAL.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Citali" (meaning "Bright Star") and is located in the community of Hueyapan, Morelos, Mexico. The group is made up of six members who know one another and are neighbors. Ms. Emelia invited them to get together and they agreed to request their first loan from Fundacion Realidad. The representative of this group is Ms. Adela B. R.. She is 40 years old and educated through the third year of secondary school. She has four children (three boys and one girl). Cesar is 19, Soledad is 14, Francisco is 12, and Alexis is 6 years old. Adela sells shirts and napkins. She is requesting this loan to buy shirts and napkins. She started this business six years ago out of economic necessity and in order to send her children to school. Her uncle makes crocheted tops and napkins from yarn. She sells the merchandise in her community of Hueyapan by going from house to house offering her goods. Her daughter helps her to collect payment from customers who owe her money. The business has helped to feed her family and to pay her children's school expenses. With her earnings, she buys more tops and napkins. She would like to improve her kitchen, as she currently has only a provisional kitchen with just a roof. She hopes to achieve this by selling more shirts and napkins. In her community of Hueyapan, the climate is cool and there are many fruits, such as pears, chokecherries, peaches, and plums. There is a lot of vegetation like trees, pine trees, and very beautiful flowers. There are also many animals, like lambs, goats, etc. Ms. Adela B. R. thanks Kiva and Fundacion Realidad for lending to her and for having confidence in her. She hopes she will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses and napkins

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 47 years old. Alex is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Alex raises crops. The main source of income for his business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alex has been engaged in his business for more than eight years. Alex joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alex has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI, a Kiva partner. Alex is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Alex from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. Her husband does the major farming duties and she helps sell their harvest. She also breeds pigs. She works hard to be able to sustain her family, especially her children's education. She wants them to finish college and find adequate jobs.

loans.name: Gardenias Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA YMELDA L. VIVE EN SAN JUAN BAUTISTA, TUXTEPEC, EN EL ESTADO DE OAXACA, TIENE 56 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE 3 HIJOS PERO VIVE SOLO CON SU HIJA DE 14 AÑOS DE EDAD QUIEN ASISTE A UNA TELESECUNDARIA DE SU COLONIA, SUS OTROS DOS HIJOS YA INDEPENDIENTES.
ELLA SE DEDICA A VENDER  PALOMITAS, CHICHARRONES Y DULCES DE LUNES A VIERNES FUERA DE LA TELESECUNDARIA A LA QUE ASISTE SU HIJA MENOR, DE ESO SE HA MANTENIDO Y HA SACADO A SUS TRES HIJOS ADELANTE, YA QUE DESDE HACE 12 AÑOS SU ESPOSO SE FUE A TIJUANA A TRABAJAR PARA PODER MANTENERLOS; PERO  NO REGRESO Y SE OLVIDO DE ELLOS, ASI QUE  LA SEÑORA YMELDA TUVO QUE  SOSTENER A SU FAMILIA SOLA, EMPEZO TRABAJANDO EN TIENDAS COMERCIALES, HASTA QUE JUNTO DINERO  PARA PODER PONER UN NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA, PERO DEBIDO A LA COMPETENCIA PERDIO A SUS CLIENTES Y SU TIENDA NO PUDO SEGUIR  ADELANTE, ASI QUE DECIDIO INVERTIR EN OTRO NEGOCIO Y EMPEZO A VENDER CHICHARRONES Y PALOMITAS, ELLA VENDE DE TODO UN POCO YA QUE  LOS SABADOS Y DOMINGOS QUE NO HAY CLASES PREPARA CHILES RELLENOS Y SALE A VENDER EN LA COLONIA, TRANSPORTA SU MATERIAL Y PRODUCTOS DE VENTA EN UN TRICICLO.
ELLA SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER INVERTIR EN MATERIA PRIMA COMO SEMILLAS PARA HACER LAS PALOMITAS, PASTA PARA HACER LOS CHICHARRONES, Y PARA COMPRAR DULCES,  ELLA QUIERE PODER TENER UN  NEGOCIO FIJO PARA NO ESTAR SALIENDO FUERA YA QUE ES PELIGROSO. ESPERA  SEGUIR TENIENDO ESTA FUENTE DE INGRESO YA QUE QUIERE HACER MEJORAS EN SU VIVIENDA, PORQUE  GRAN  PARTE  DE SU CASA  ES DE CARTON.
ES POR ESO QUE AGRADECE A FUNDACION HABER CONFIADO EN ELLA Y ASI HABER INGRESADO SU SOLICITUD DE PRESTAMO, JUNTO CON SUS DEMAS  COMPAÑERAS, QUIENES AHORAN FORMAN PARTE DEL GRUPO CONFORMADO POR  11 PERSONAS  LLAMADO GARDENIAS, ASI SE HIZO LLAMAR  YA QUE SU PATIO ESTA CERCADO CON ESTAS FLORES Y EN LA REUNION LES LLAMO LA ATENCION EL OLOR TAN AGRADABLE QUE DESPRENDEN ASI QUE DECIDIERON LLAMARLO ASI.
LAS INTEGRANTES SON PATRICIA V. C.; QUIEN POR MAS DE DOS AÑOS SE DEDICA A HACER PIÑATAS Y MANUALIDADES PARA FIESTAS, APRENDIO ESTA ACTIVIDAD EN UN CURSO QUE SE IMPARTIO EN LA COLONIA Y APROVECHO PARA PONER UN NEGOCIO DE ESTE TIPO, IRENE C. H.; QUIEN HACE ANTOJITOS LOS SABADOS Y DOMINGOS EN SU CASA,  MARIA LUISA C. J.; QUIEN TAMBIEN ELABORA ANTOJITOS, MELISSA G. V., UNA CHICA QUE A SU CORTA EDAD YA EMPRENDIO UN NEGOCIO EN SU CASA, HACE HIELITOS Y GELATINAS, MERCEDES C. V.; QUIEN CRIA Y VENDE CERDOS,  FELICITAS G. S. QUIEN VENDE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO CON SUS AMISTADES, CADA SEMANA ESTA SOLICITANDO PEDIDOS Y SE ESTA SURTIENDO DE CALZADO, BENITA I. C.;QUIEN VENDE ROPA CON SUS AMISTADES, ANGELA S. G.; VENDE DULCES FUERA DE SU CASA, TAMBIEN ELABORA TAMALES  OAXAQUEÑOS Y LOS OFRECE A SUS AMISTADES, SILVIA H. L. ;VENDE ANTOJITOS EN LA ESCUELA DE LUNES A VIERNES,  ELDA V. F. QUIEN VENDE  ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO. 
TODAS ELLAS  FORMAN  EL GRUPO GARDENIAS, QUIEREN SER SIEMPRE PUNTUAL  EN SUS PAGOS Y SEGUIR TRABAJANDO COMO LO HAN HECHO HASTA AHORA. 
SENTIR QUE AUNQUE ALGUNAS ESTAN SOLAS SIN APOYO DE NADIE MAS, SE TIENEN COMO AMIGAS Y CONOCIDAS, Y SABER QUE FUNDACION  ESTA CON ELLAS ES GRATIFICANTE.
texts.en:
Ymelda L. lives in San Juan Bautista, Tuxtepec, Oaxaca State. She is 56 years old and has 3 children. She lives with her daughter, who is 14 years old and attends the local secondary school. Ymelda's other two sons have already left home. From Monday to Friday she sells popcorn, pork rinds and sweets outside the secundary school her daughter attends. The activity has enabled her to support her three children. Her husband left for Tijuana 12 years ago to work and support his family but he never came back and forgot about them. Ymelda started off by working in shops until she saved enough money to set up her own grocery business from home, but due to the competition she lost her customers and her shop. She then decided to invest in a different line of business and started to sell pork rinds and popcorn. She sells a bit of everything. On Saturday and Sunday, when there is no school, she makes stuffed chiles and sells them in town. She uses a tricycle to transport materials and produce to sell. She requests the loan to invest in ingredients such as seeds to make popcorn, dough to make pork rinds and sweets. She would like to have a fixed business rather than be out and about as it is dangerous. She hopes to continue in this line of business because she wants to improve her house, which at the moment is largely made of cardboard. She would like to thank Fundacion for having trusted her and sent through her loan request, alongside those of the remaining members of the group. The 11-person group is called Gardenias because the patio where they meet is surrounded by flowers of this kind and their pleasant smell caught their attention. The other group members are: Patricia V. C., who learnt to make piñatas and handicrats for parties two years ago and has had her own business since; Irene Cabañas H., who makes snacks in her home on Saturdays and Sundays; Maria Luisa C. J., who also makes snacks; Melissa G. V., a young girl who started a business from home selling ice lollies and jelly; Mercedes C. V., who raises and sells pigs; Felicitas G. S., who sells shoes to her friends through a catalog and is getting orders in every week; Benita I. C., who sells clothes to her friends; Angela S. G., who sells sweets outside her home and tamales to her friends; Silvia H. L., who sells snacks in the school from Monday to Friday; and Elda V. F., who sells shoes through a catalog. The Gardenias Group aims to be always on time with their payments and to keep on working as they have done until now. Although some of the members are on their own, with no help from anyone else, they support each other as friends and are glad that Fundacion is also on their side.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her products, such as sweets and seeds to make popcorn to sell outside the school

loans.name: Tafuta Upate Group

texts.en:
Meet Hidaya I. and the Tafuta Upate Group. Hidaya is 35 years old and married. She has two daughters who are 11 and 6 years old, and both go to school. About a year ago, Hidaya opened a kiosk shop selling soda, juice, water, biscuits, and phone credit. She works long hours (from 7am until 11pm), but business is going well. Hidaya makes a profit of around $400 per month. 

This will be Hidaya's first loan. She will use it to increase her inventory of beer and soda. She also wants to add sales of cooked breakfast and lunches to her business, so part of the loan will be used to purchase meat, rice, and potatoes. She dreams of eventually opening a very big and successful restaurant. 

Hidaya will share this loan with the 17 members of her group. The members run a variety of businesses such as sales of used clothes, fruits, vegetables and drinks. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

In the photo, Hidaya is seated in the front row and is wearing a yellow shirt.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and to add cooked food

texts.en:
Currently, Stella A. is in the business of selling maize flour and rice at the market and she is requesting a loan to also stock bags of beans to sell.  Stella is 33 years-old and is married with a husband that is a business man. She has two children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan.
