Lucia is 50 years old and is widowed.   She has 9 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of groundnuts and dried cassava to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: K. Christine est née en 1974 à Akpro-Missérété dans le département du Plateau. Christine est mariée à SATONWANOU Etienne et est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Christine vit ensemble avec sa famille à Missérété Centre. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Christine a appris la coiffure. De façon secondaire, Christine vend de l'huile végétale dans son atelier de coiffure. Christine s'approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui avait obtenu antérieurement trois crédits et qu'elle a tous bien remboursés, malgré les méventes qu'elle a enregistré quelquefois au niveau de son activité. Actuellement, Christine désire augmenter son stock de produits et mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Christine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
K. Christine was born in 1974 in Akpro-Missérété in 'Plateau' county. Christine is married to SATONWANOU Etienne and is the mother of four children, some of whom are enrolled in school. Christine lives with her family in Missérété Centre. The couple share the various responsibilities of supporting their family. Christine learned to be a hairdresser. Secondarily, she sells vegetable oil in her beauty salon. She gets her supplies in the market of Ouando in Porto-Novo, administrative capital of Bénin. She is a long-time client of ALIDé and has received three prior loans which she reimbursed correctly, despite certain misadventures with her businesses. Presently, Christine wishes to add to her inventory and better satisfy the needs of her clientele. This is the reason why Christine is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics and jerrycans of vegetable oil

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina N. is currently in the business of photo-copying and binding books in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock stapling machines and printing paper to sell.  Medina is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is an electrician. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up an internet cafe. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock stapling machines and printing papers to sell

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: H. Blandine est née en 1972 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Blandine vit depuis trente trois ans environs au quartier Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Blandine est mariée à SAVOEDO Bertin, un menuisier. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble. Blandine vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Blandine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Blandine vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, lait, riz, savons, huile végétale) ainsi que des produits vivriers (riz, farine de manioc, etc.)  et des sandalettes à son domicile. Blandine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Blandine a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Blandine désire développer davantage son activité et accroître sa clientèle et par la même occasion son chiffre d’affaire. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
H. Blandine was born in 1972 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Blandine has been living for about 33 years in the Agblangandan district in the township of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin. Blandine is married to SAVOEDO Bertin, a carpenter. The couple have two children who are both enrolled in school. The family live together. Blandine helps her husband cover the various expenses of the family. She did not attend school. She sells various items (pasta, tinned foods, milk, soap, vegetable oil) as well as other foodstuffs (rice, manioc flour, etc.) and sandals out of her home. She buys her inventory in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Blandine has already received two loans from ALIDé and reimbursed them appropriately. She would like to further expand her business and grow her clientele, as well as her turnover. That is why she is asking for a third loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pasta, rice, milk, soap, vegetable oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Dil Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Dil Kumari D. is a farmer in the village of Chappagaun. She owns a piece of land where she grows green vegetables. Mostly she grows seasonal vegetables on her land and sells vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 10000.00 to buy seeds and fertilizers for her vegetable farming.

Mrs. Dil Kumari lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her older son is studying in university and her younger son is studying in grade 12.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Abu B.

texts.en:
Abu B. F. is a devoted, hard-working and very sincere business man. His business is located along Rogbaneh Rd. which is one of the busy streets in  Makeni. He got his business capital from his father after he dropped out of school.

Abu is married to a businesswoman who also helps him with his business. He sells electrical materials, tape recorders, and building materials which he has  done for 10 years. How to manage his business in such a way that he gets his livelihood and can continue in business is his challenge. 

Abu needs a loan to improve his business and make it more profitable. He intends using the proceeds of his loan to send his eldest son to college, feed his family, pay school fees, and build a family house.

loans.use: To buy additional electrical and building materials for resale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen D. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock rice and pulses (lentils) to sell.  Hellen is 34 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop for her goods.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock rice and pulses to sell

loans.name: Berechissou

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et a un enfant, elle vit avec son mari dans le quartier abové qui est un quartier périphérique de Lomé ; elle fait le commerce des habits pour enfants. Elle souhaite gonfler son stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 2 grand cartons d’habits pour enfant.
texts.en:
This lady is married and has one child. She lives with her husband in the Abové district, which is an outlying district of Lomé. She sells clothing for children. She would like to expand her inventory so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 2 big cartons of children's clothing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Née en 1979, A. Gisèle vit depuis une douzaine d’année au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Gisèle est mariée à MEHOU Ange, un coiffeur. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Gisèle vit avec son mari et son enfant à Fidjrossè. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Gisèle n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis environs huit ans, Gisèle vend divers produits de soins (savons, etc.) et des bassines en plastique par le système de distribution. Gisèle achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Gisèle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but d'agrandir son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Gisèle sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1979, A. Gisèle has been living for about 12 years in the Fidjrossè district in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Gisèle is married to MEHOU Ange, a barber. The couple has one child who is enrolled in school. Gisèle lives with her husband and her child in Fidjrossè. The couple share the responsibility for supporting their family. Gisèle was not able to attend school. For about eight years, Gisèle has been selling various personal care products (soap, etc.) and plastic basins through the distribution system. She buys her products in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Gisèle has already received from ALIDé two loans that she reimbursed correctly. Wishing to grow her business and better cope with the increasing demand of her clientele, Gisèle is asking ALIDé for a third loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of soap, plastic basins, etc.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba P. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and pillows at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dresses and pairs of trousers to sell.  Araba is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fess for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock dresses and pairs of trousers to sell

loans.name: Surja Maiya

texts.en:
Surja Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho Village. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. The majority of the people living in this region are Newar, the indigenous people of Nepal's Kathmandu Valley. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people living in this region are engaged in seasonal farming.


Mrs. Surja Maiya M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son. Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is engaged in selling chickens. Her husband and son also equally contribute their effort to that business. They sell broiler chickens in their shop. 



Due to the increasing demand of their customers, Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 30,000 to buy chickens for their business.

loans.use: to buy boiler chickens

loans.name: Yawa Dadignon

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce  comme  activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois; elle s’approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays ce qui lui permet de réaliser une plus grosse marge sur ses ventes. Les pluies diluviennes de ces derniers temps ont détruit une partie de son stock de marchandises. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour  l’achat de 30 sacs de charbons de bois
Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants
texts.en:
This lady earns her living by selling charcoal. She gets her stocks from rural areas which allows her to make a bigger profit on her sales. The recent heavy rains have destroyed part of her inventory. She would like to stock up again and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 sacks of charcoal. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: Née en 1979, A. Delphine est mariée à AGBOGBE Evarice et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Delphine  vit avec sa famille au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d'année. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Delphine n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Delphine exerce cette activité depuis près de douze ans. A côté de cette activité, Delphine vend des tissus et divers autres produits dans son atelier situé à son domicile. Delphine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Delphine a déjà obtenu deux prêts à ALIDé et les a tous bien remboursés. Delphine désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et compléter le stock de ses produits, ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenus. C'et donc pour une satisfaction de sa clientèle et un accroissement de son revenu que Delphine sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Delphine A., who was born in 1979, is married to Evarice Agbogbe, and is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. Along with her family, Delphine has lived in the Fidjrossè area of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, for the last 10 years or so. Together, the couple meet the various needs of the family. Delphine did not go to school, but she learnt how to sew. She has been a seamstress for almost twelve years. In addition to this activity, she sells fabric and various other items in her workshop which is located in her home. Delphine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She has already obtained two loans from ALIDé and has fully repaid both of them. Delphine wants to increase her working capitol and add to her inventory, which will allow her to better meet the needs of her customers and to increase her revenue. She is asking for a third loan in order to satisfy her customers and increase her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and boxes of thread

loans.name: Sinclair

texts.fr:
jeune commercant de 30 ans, celibataire s'est lance dans l'alimentation et vente des pains il ya bientot 10 ans, tres jeune n'ayant aucun soutien,il ouvre un etalage, avec 50000frs qu'il avait epargner par la vente des pains.Ses ventes sont de 15000 a 25000 frs par jour, et pour sa strategie il se leve de bonne heure et va acheter du pain chaud a la boulangerie, et fait des portes a portes en criant dans les ruelles de son quartier, et partir de 8 h il ouvre son kiosque ou il vend le reste du pains et les produits de son alimentation.
Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir il va acheter des cartons de lait en poudre comme le lait belle Holandaise,le lait Nido,sac de sucre de 50kg ,les conserves et les differents produits de lessive et bains.
Son ambition, c'est d'avoir un magasin d'alimentation, se marier un jour et fonder une famille.
dans le quartier tout le monde le connait du plus petit au plus grand.
texts.en:
This young merchant, 30, is single and he started out selling groceries and bread almost 10 years ago. Very young and having no one to support him, he opened up a stall with 50,000 francs that he had saved up by selling bread. His sales amount to 15,000 to 25,000 francs a day. His strategy is to get up early and buy warm bread from the bakery, then go from door to door, calling out his wares, in the back streets of his community. At 8 am he opens his kiosk where he sells the remaining loaves of bread and other foodstuffs. With the loan that he is counting on receiving, he is going to buy cartons of powdered milk such as "la belle Hollandaise" and "Nido" milk, a sack of 50 kg of sugar, tinned foods, and various detergents and bath soaps. His ambition is to open up a real grocery store, to get married one of these days, and start a family. In his neighborhood everyone has known him since he was a child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of powdered milk, butter, sugar, detergents, toilet soap, and tinned goods

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Jariatu is a very hard-working businesswoman. Her business is located along Yiks Road, Makeni. She was initially financed by her husband and began selling foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past 20 years.

Jariatu is married to a businessman who also helps her with her business. Her challenge is, how to improve her business to the level that she can continue to serve her customers in a cost-effective way and at the same time help her husband support their family. She needs a loan to buy more stock.  She however intends to use the proceeds of her loan to help her husband educate their children to university level and buy a plot of land where they could build a  house.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for stall

loans.name: Monte Verde Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA MARIA CELINDA G. S. VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD DE BENITO JUAREZ MUNICPIO DE COPAINALA ESTADO DE CHIAPAS, MEXICO TIENE  32 AÑOS DE EDAD ESTA CASADA CON EL SEÑOR NOLBERTO VILLALOBOS H. Y CON QUIEN PROCREO 4 HIJOS, LA PRIMERA ES BLANCA NIDIA DE  15 AÑOS Y CURSA EL TERCERO DE TELESECUNDARIA, SANDRA MARELEY DE 14 AÑOS CURSA EL SEGUNDO DE TELESECUNDARIA, JOSE HEBREY DE 11 AÑOS DE QUINTO DE PRIMARIAY EL MAS PEQUEÑO DE 6 AÑOS LUIS DAVID EN PRESCOLAR.
ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS, EL CUAL COMENTA  LE VA MUY BIEN EN LA ECONOMIA  DESDE QUE INICIO ESTE TRABAJO.
LA QUE LA MOTIVO A REALIZAR  ESTA ACTIVIDAD FUE SU FAMILA, PARA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTO DE LA CASA Y DE SUS HIJOS A LOS CUALES LES QUIERE DAR UNA BUENA EDUCACION Y MEJOR FUTURO DE VIDA.
EL CREDITO LO SOLICITO PARA HACER MAS GRANDE SU NEGOCIO COMPRANDO MÁS PRODUCTOS BÁSICOS COMO ARROZ, ACEITE, FRIJOL, ETC., Y  CON LAS GANACIAS DESEA AHORRAR  PARA CONSTRUIR UN LOCAL MAS AMPLIO Y VENDER AHÍ SUS PRODUCTOS.  
EL GRUPO SE LLAMA MONTE VERDE, LA RAZON DEL NOMBRE ES POR QUE EN CASA DE LAS SEÑORAS TIENEN DE HORNATO PLANTAS SILVESTRES QUE ENGALANAN SUS  JARDIN.  MARIA CELINDA FORMO ESTE GRUPO CON SUS COMPAÑERAS Y HOY ES REPRESENTANTE.
LAS INTEGRANTES QUE FORMAN ESTE GRUPO MONTE VERDE SON:

•	FLOR DE LUZ V. S. QUIEN SE DEDICA A VENDER ROPA.
•	VICTORIA V. L. EN LA ELABORACION LONGANIZAS
•	BLANCA ADALI M. S. COMPRA Y VENDE COSMETICOS DE CATALOGO.
•	Y LA REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO MARIA CELINDA G. DANCHEZ EN LA VENTA DE ABARROTES.

  ES ASÍ  COMO LAS SEÑORAS AGRADECEN EL PRESTAMO QUE FUNDACION REALIDAD A.C. LES OTORGA.
texts.en:
Maria Celinda G. S. lives in the town of Benito Juarez, Copainala Municipality in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. She is thirty-two and is married to Nolberto Villalobos H., with whom she has four children. Her eldest, Blanca Nadia, 15, is in her third year of Telesecundaria [lower secondary school with television support]. Sandra Mareley,14, is in her second year of Telesecundaria. Jose Hebrey is 11 and in his fifth year of primary school. The youngest, Luis David, is 6 and in preschool. Maria Celinda has made her living selling groceries for two years. She says business has been going very well since she started out. She went into business because of her family, so she could help her husband with the household expenses, and give her children a good education and a better future. She is seeking a loan to grow her business by purchasing more basic items like rice, oil, beans, etc. She wants to save up her profits to build a bigger shop where she can sell her products. Maria Celinda's group is called Monte Verde, because the women's houses are adorned with wild plants that decorate their gardens. Maria Celinda started this group with her friends and today is their representative. The members of the Monte Verde group are: • Flor de Luz V. S. (sells clothing) • Victoria V. L., (makes sausages) • Blanca Adali Muñoz S. (buys and sells cosmetics through catalogs) • Group Representative Maria Celina G. S. (sells groceries) The women of this group appreciate the loans they receive from Fundación Realidad A.C.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store, including sugar, beans, oil, soups, eggs, soap, etc.

loans.name: Segnon Marie

texts.fr: H. segnon marie a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail des bassines et des des produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005, sa clientèle se compose en grande majorité de femmes. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et réaliser des chiffres d’affaire plus élevés ; elle sollicite du crédit pour l’achat de 16 bassines en plastique et divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
H. Segnon Marie earns her living retailing basins and cosmetics. She has been in this business since 2005, and her clientele is mostly composed of women. She wants to restock and raise her turnover. She is asking for a loan to buy 16 plastic basins and various cosmetics.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of plastic basins and cosmetics

loans.name: Marie N'ke

texts.fr: Née en 1960, S. Marie N'Ke est mariée à KOUTADO Lazare, un douanier à la retraite. Marie N'Ke est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Mais le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge, en plus de leur enfant. Il y a près de dix sept ans que Marie N'Ke vit au quartier Cocotomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marie N'Ke vit ensemble avec ses deux enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Marie N'Ke n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Marie N'Ke vend des friperies à son domicile, ce qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Marie N'Ke achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Marie N'Ke sollicite auprès de ALIDé un concours financier, en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Marie N'Ke a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu'elle avait obtenu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1960, S. Marie N'Ke is married to KOUTADO Lazare, a retired customs agent. Marie N'Ke is the mother of one child who is enrolled in school. However, the couple is responsible for another child besides their biological child. For almost 17 years Marie N'Ke has been living in the Cocotomey district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Marie N'Ke lives together with her two children and her husband. The couple share the responsibility for supporting their family. Marie N'Ke only attended elementary school. For about 12 years, Marie N'Ke has been selling used clothing out of her home, which brings in income that helps her to support herself. She buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. This is the second time that she is requesting a loan from ALIDé, aimed at expanding her business and better satisfying her clientele. She correctly reimbursed her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of two bales of used clothing

loans.name: Las Campesinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Campesinas”  nombrado así por que se dedican al campo, todos son originarios de la Ranchería El Chiflón de Nacajuca, Tabasco. Es integrado por 1 hombre y tres mujeres. Los representa Flor De Liz Rodríguez Sánchez ella es soltera, tiene también una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, María Santa Sánchez Rodríguez, tiene 2 hijos, Carlos Rodríguez Sánchez, tiene 5 hijos, Luisa Sánchez Rodríguez tiene 6 hijos.
Doña Luisa lo solicitó para la cría de pollos, el resto del grupo tiene un crédito de ganadería para la compra de Cría de becerros.  
Flor de Liz comprara becerros, vacunas y también para comprar mercancía para su tienda (azúcar, frijol, maíz, sabritas, refrescos). Ella sueña tener una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida para abastecer la demanda de la comunidad ya que por donde vive casi no hay tienda cerca. 
Son un grupo solidario muy trabajador, muy alegre y sus actividades son de ganadería con el crédito quieren empezar  a comprar sus ganados y sueñan con que sus hijos terminen la preparatoria y puedan estudiar también una carrera universitaria. 
Agradecen de antemano el gran apoyo que le ofrece la Fundación y KIVA por creer en ellos para otorgarles un financiamiento.
texts.en:
"Las Campesinas" (Country People), is so named because the group works in the rural areas. It consists of one man and three women, all natives of Ranchería el Chiflón de Nacajuca. They are represented by Flor de Liz Rodríguez, who is single and has a grocery store in her house. María Santa Sánchez Rodrígues has two children, Carlos Rodrígues Sánchez has five children, and Luisa Sánchez Rodríguez has six children. Luisa asked for a loan so she could raise chickens. The rest of the group wanted a loan for livestock so they could buy calves to raise. Flor de Liz will buy calves and cows as well as merchandise for her store (sugar, beans, corn, chips, and soft-drinks). She dreams of having a well-stocked grocery store so she can satisfy the community's demands, since where she lives there aren't any stores nearby. This is a very tight-knit group, hardworking and happy. They are in the cattle business and want to use their loan to buy cows. They dream that their children will finish high-school and be able to go to college, too. They offer their appreciation in advance to the Fundación for its great support, and to Kiva for believing in them enough to provide a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves, cows, and vitamins, as well as grocery store merchandise (sugar, beans, corn, chips, soft-drinks)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improvement on his house and university studies

loans.name: Arcoiris De La Cruz Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Arcoiris D. L. C.”  nombrado así por que son un grupo alegre y todas son  originarias D. L. Ranchería L. C.. Es integrado por cinco mujeres. Los representa doña María RemeD. López Sánchez, todos sus hijos están casados, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. pescado junto con su esposo. Doña Doris D. D. V., tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a L. venta D. cerdo junto con Martha C. O., doña Martha tiene 1 hija; María D. Los Santos D. L. C. L. tiene 1 hija  y Araceli D. D. López tiene 2 niñas,  ambas se dedican  a L. venta D. pollos que crían en sus respectivos domicilios. 

Doña Mello (como le llaman a Maria Remedioa)junto con su esposo tienen su venta D. pescado D. manera ambulante que sale a vender su esposo en un triciclo en L. misma ranchería y comunidades vecinas  y también tiene su venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en su domicilio como azúcar, arroz, leche, galletas, refrescos, etc. Sueña con tener una tienda D. abarrotes bien surtida.

Todas ellas son mujeres  muy trabajadoras, alegres  y sus actividades son algunas variadas, es un grupo  solidario y se conocen desD. hace años.  

Agradecen el apoyo que le brinda L. Fundación y KIVA por ser considerados para poder realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
The Arcoiris D. L. C. (Rainbow of the Cross) group got its name because they are a happy group, and all of them are from the C. settlement. The group is comprised of five women. María RemeD. López Sánchez represents the group. All of her children are married. She and her husband sell fish together. Doris D. D. V. has two children. She sells pigs together with Martha C. O.. Martha has a daughter. María D. Los Santos D. L. C. L. has one daughter, and Araceli D. D. López has two daughters. They both sell chicken that they raise in their respective homes. Mello (as they call Maria Remedioa) and her husband have a business selling fish. Her husband sells in an itinerant way. He leaves on his tricycle to sell in the same settlement and neighboring communities. She also sells basic needs products in her home. She sells products like sugar, rice, milk, cookies, and soft drinks, etc. She dreams of having a well stocked grocery store. They are all very hard-working and happy women. Their activities are varied. They are a supportive group, and they have known each other for years. They are grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the support they have provided and for considering them so that they can continue their small businesses and make their dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, vaccines, food, fish ( (perch and gar fish), pigs, vitamins, lipstick, eyeliners, perfume, and eye shadow

loans.name: Rolando Bladimir

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 24 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Osicala del departamento de Morazán, es soltero, vive con sus dos hermanos y se dedica a la confección de hamacas.
Aprendió  el oficio gracias a su madre de la edad de 13 años y tiene tres años de manejar su negocio que en colaboración de sus hermanos elaboran hamacas, todos los días desde muy temprano se dedican a tejer ya que de esta producción depende los ingresos para subsistir.
Rolando necesita el préstamo para compra de hilos de seda de diferentes colores, manquillas, tubos, que son materiales para la elaboración de las hamacas, esto ayudara para que  disponga de los materiales y seguir trabajando para  generar ingresos,solventar necesidades básicas de su familia.
Su objetivo es realizar una buena inversión, su sueño es incrementar su negocio, ventas, mejorar los ingresos y garantizar la sostenibilidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is twenty-four years old and lives in the municipality of Osicala, in the department of Morazan. He is single, lives with his two brothers, and makes hammocks for a living. He learned this trade from his mom when when he was thirteen and has been running this business, making hammocks with his brothers, for three years. They begin weaving early in the morning each day because their income depends on what they produce. Rolando needs a loan to buy different colors of silk threads, sleeves, and tubes -- all materials for making hammocks. This will help him get the materials and be able to continue earning an income and taking care of his family's needs. His goal is to make a good investment and he dreams of growing his business, sales, and of improving his earnings to guarantee his family's security.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different colored silk thread, sleeves, tubes.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: B. Cécile est née en 1951 et vit depuis une trentaine d’année au quartier Sèdégbé dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi au Bénin. Cécile est une veuve et mère d’un enfant qui est à sa charge. Cécile vit seule avec son enfant et assure seule les charges de la famille. Cécile a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis près de trente cinq ans, Cécile mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (savons, riz, œufs, conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, papier hygiénique, bougies, piles, eau de javel, etc.) et aussi des condiments à son domicile. Cécile achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Cécile sollicite un appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser davantage le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle. Cécile a bien remboursé le premier prêt qu’elle avait obtenu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Cécile B. was born in 1951, and for the last thirty years or so she has lived in the Sèdégbé area in the commune of Abomey Calavi, in Benin. Cécile is a widow, and the mother of one child in her care. She lives alone with her child and takes on the family expenses by herself. Cécile left school at the secondary level. For almost thirty five years she has been working at selling various products (soap, rice, eggs, canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, bathroom tissue, candles, batteries, bleach, etc.) as well as condiments, at her house. Cécile buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. This is the second time that Cécile has asked for financial support from ALIDé, with the goal of increasing the level of her activity even more, and to gain more customers. Cécile has fully repaid the first loan that she obtained from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets of tomatoes and various products (rice, eggs, canned foods, milk, candles, etc.)

loans.name: Anjou

texts.fr: Monsieur Anjou N. est un animateur en music de  37 ans. Il exerce parallèlement  l’activité  de ventes d’appareils de portables téléphoniques. Il s’est lancé dans cette activité par passion. Il habite à Daroukhoudosse, il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mars 2004 et a déjà  bénéficié  de 6 prêts  antérieurs. C’est durant les fins de mois que son activité  marche le plus. Monsieur N. emprunte 300 000 frs dans l’objectif de renforcer son stock de portables et accroitre ses bénéfices. Ce crédit  pourra constituer une solution  à son souci de financement de son activité. Ainsi il pourra renforcer le soutien qu’il  assurait a ses parents et amis qui sont plus demunis.
texts.en:
Mister Anjou N. is a 37 year old disc jockey. At the same time, he sells mobile phones. He started this business out of passion. He lives in Daroukhoudosse. He has been a member of the Baye Laye credit institution since March 2004 and has already received 6 loans in the past. His activity is most successful at the end of each month. Mister N. is borrowing 300,000 francs in order to build up his supplies in mobile phones and increase his profits. This loan could help him solve his activity’s financing problems. He will thus be able to provide better support for his parents and friends who are worst off.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Née en 1965, T. Marguerite vit depuis une quinzaine d’année au quartier Sèdégbé, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Marguerite a quatre enfants à sa charge, dont trois représentent ses propres enfants. Certains de ces enfants sont scolarisés. Marguerite est une veuve. Marguerite vit donc seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Marguerite a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Marguerite vend divers produits (conserves de tomate et de sardine, pâtes alimentaires, lait, savons, papier hygiénique, piles, etc.) ainsi que des condiments de sauce (piments, tomates, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Marguerite achète ses produits. Marguerite exerce cette activité depuis seize ans environs et a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé. Marguerite a bien remboursé ledit crédit. Dans le but de renforcer un peu plus son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Marguerite sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Marguerite T. has been living in the Sèdégbé neighborhood of the Abomey-Calavi commune for approximately fifteen years. She has four children in her care, three of which are her own children. Some of them are in school. Marguerite is a widow. She lives alone with her children and provides for their needs on her own. Marguerite’s formal education was minimal. To support herself and her children, she sells various products (e.g. canned tomatoes and sardines, pasta, milk, soap, toilet paper, batteries) and sauce condiments (peppers, tomatoes, etc.) from her home. She gets her stocks in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Marguerite has been in business for about sixteen years and has obtained one loan through Alidé in the past, which was repaid without problems. In order to strengthen her activities and better meet her customers’ needs, Marguerite is seeking a second loan.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk, canned sardines, pasta, soap, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr:
Femme celibataire de 50 ans,celibataire avec 3 enfants,agee de 26 a 33 ans,  diplomee sans emploi  de l'Ecole paramedicale de la Sante,Il ya 20 ans qu'elle s'est lancee dans la vente de bois quand elle a compris qu'elle ne trouverait pas de place a la fonction publique. 
Elle s'approvisionne sur place , elle se met en contact avec les commercants ambulants  qui sillonent dans les quartiers et parfois , elle prend des contacts avec tous ceux qui sont dans la livraison du bois a domicile. Ses recettes sont de 30000 a 45000frs par jour,et ses potentiels clients sont les menages.Ayant une grande experience , elle a eleve tous ses enfants avec les recettes de la vente de bois de chauffe.
Avec le pret octroye,elle pense renforcer son stock en achetant des paquets de bois.Elle epargne beaucoup pour realiser ses ambitions,soutenir les etudes de ses enfants qui sont a l'universite et enfin construire une maison sur le terrain acquerit avec les benefices de ses ventes pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Single woman, 50 years of age, with three children from 26 to 33 years old; unemployed although she has a paramedic’s diploma. About 20 years ago, as she realized she couldn’t’ get a job in the public sector, she started selling firewood. She buys her sotck locally, networking with street vendors who walk around town and sometimes she also arranges for deliveries to be made to her home. Her revenue is between 30000 and 45000 Central African franks per day, and her potential clients are households. She has a lot of experience, and has been able to raise her children thanks to the income from selling firewood. With this loan obtained, she would like to increase her stock and purchase additional loads of firewood. She puts a lot of her income aside as savings in order to be able to realize her plans, support the university studies of her children and eventually build a house for her children on a land parcel purchased with the income from her sales.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on firewood [for resale]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover the cost of medicine for his mother.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: T. Marcelline est née en 1977 et est mariée à AGBOGBE Virgile, un mécanicien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Marcelline s’est installée au quartier Fidjrossè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Marcelline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis huit ans environs, Marcelline vend divers produits (vêtements pour enfants, sous-vêtements, sandalettes, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile. Marcelline achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marcelline a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Dan le but de renforcer son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle, pour se faire plus de profits, Marcelline sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Marcelline was born in 1977 and is married to Mr. AGBOGBE Virgile, a mechanic.  The couple have two children who are both in school.  About ten years ago, she settled in the Fidjrossè district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she lives with her husband and children.  The couple share in covering their different family expenses.  Marcelline did not attend school.  For about eight years, she has been selling various goods (clothing for children, undergarments, flip-flop sandals, cassava flour, etc.) out of her home.  She purchases her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has already had two loans, which were repaid.  With the goal of bolstering her business and growing her customer base, Marcelline is requesting a third loan from ALIDé in order to make more profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing, undergarments, and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy crossbeams, blocks, cement, labor

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr: B. malik a appris la mécanique, en 2007, il a ouvert son atelier qu’il a appelé « Garage MECASSISTANCE », les outils de tournage et  d’ajustement de pièces d étachées qu’il utilise sont en panne c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite du crédit pour acheter une perceuse à colonne.etant célibataire, le revenu de ce commerce lui permet de pouvoir se prendre en charge
texts.en:
Malik B. learned mechanics, and in 2007, he opened his own workshop which he called «Garage MECASSISTANCE ». The tools that he uses for turning and adjusting the spare parts have broken down, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy a column drill. Being single, the revenue from his business will allow him to care for himself.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a column drill.

loans.name: Cindy Kaina

texts.es:
Cindy de 26 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana con una ecología en disolución), tiene un hijo y su esposo es albañil, ellos viven en una casa de caña. ella es profesora en reuniones del Programa “Children Internacional” (es un jardín de niños que tienen en su casa). 

Ella trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 12h00pm como profesora en el jardín de niños que tienen en su casa. Con la ayuda de su mama ha podido administrar con bien el jardín de niños.

 Pero como lo tiene en su casa y no tiene los medios adecuados para los niños ella quiere con el préstamo comprar cemento, bloques y arena para construir su casa mejor. En el futuro ella quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Cindy lives in El Paraíso, located in Guayaquil (a peri-urban zone with a deteriorating ecosystem). She has a son and her husband is a bricklayer. They live in a house made of reeds. She works from 7am to 12pm as a teacher for the "Children International" program, which is a kindergarten for kids that meet in her house. With the help of her mother, she has been able to successfully run the kindergarten. However, because the kindergarten meets in her home and she does not have adequate means for the children she is requesting the loan which will be used to buy cement, cinder block and sand in order to build a better house. In the future she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement

loans.name: Rosa Yadira

texts.es: La señora Rosa Yadira labora procesando datos en la universidad de Unica  tiene un hijo , es casada y el crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizare en Pago de mano de obra para aguas negras, compra de tubos pvc, cemento, bloque arena, construcción de baño, piedrín hierro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Yadira works as a data processor at the UNICA university. She has a child and is married. She's asking for a loan from CEPRODEL to pay for labor to clean up contaminated water and bathroom construction; and buy PVC pipes, cement, sand blocks; gravel, and iron.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of labor for bathroom construction and construction supplies such as PVC pipe, cement, sand blocks, gravel, and iron

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
Doña Norma es una mujer trabajadora, casada y madre de familia de dos hijos, desde hace varios años esta vendiendo ropa y prendas para mejorar los ingresos de la casa, ya que ambos niños estudian.

Su esposo labora como conductor y solo con su salario no se ajusta es por eso decide iniciar su venta. 
Como madre lo que mas desea es un techo propio, ya que tiene varios años viviendo en casa de su suegra, tiene un cuarto a parte con sus electrodomésticos, pero no es igual a lo propio.

No han comprado el terreno por que no cuentan con el dinero en efectivo y los préstamo los invierte en mercadería para poder a justar con los gastos alimenticios, estudios y otros gastos.
Con este préstamo comprara ropa de dama, caballero y niños,  así como prendas para lograr aumentar las ventas. ya que tiene poca ropa en existencia.
texts.en:
Doña Norma is married and has two children. She is a hard-working woman. For the past several years she has been selling clothing in order to augment the household income since both of her children are in school. Her husband works as a driver and his salary alone is not enough. For this reason she decided to start her business. As a mother, what she wants most is a house of her own, since she has been living with her mother-in-law for several years. She has a separate room with appliances, but it is not the same as having her own home. She has not bought the land because she doesn't have the cash and she has used the loans to cover food, education and other expenses. With this loan she will buy men's, women's and children's clothing in order to increase her sales since she has little clothing in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's, women's and children's clothing to resell

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Yacine M. est une habitante de la localité  de Baye Laye. Elle est âgée  de 40 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse depuis décembre  2009. Elle est mariée,  mère  d’un enfant et ayant a sa charge une autre personne. Madame M. vient de démarrer  une activité de vente de petit déjeuner  et souhaiterait la développer. Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs. Les bénéfices  qui seront générés  par son activité  lui permettront d ‘apporter  une assistance financière a son mari concernant les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Yacine M. is a resident of the town of Baye Laye. She is 40 years old and has been an associate of the credit association since December 2009.  She is married and the mother of one child and has another person to support.  Yacine just started a business selling breakfast and wishes to develop it.  Consequently, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs.  The profit that will be generated by her business will allow her to help out her husband financially regarding family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Guadalupe R. le esta haciendo falta la instalación de luz, pero no cuenta  con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara.
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así tener luz en su casa, ya que vive sola. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de ingreso que obtiene de su trabaja como empleada de limpieza en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe R.’s home needs electricity, but she does not have enough money to buy the material and to pay the person to install it. Because of this, she is soliciting a loan that will allow her to have light in her house, since she lives alone. She plans to repay the loan with a part of her income, which she obtains from her work as a cleaner in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to install electricity

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Née en 1966, K. Josephine est mariée à ALLOSSE Théodore, un gendarme. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Josephine vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Sèdégbé dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Josephine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Josephine mène comme activité la vente de condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, conserves de tomate, poissons frits, oeufs, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Josephine vend des plastiques. Josephine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Josephine a déjà obtenu de ALIDé, deux prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Josephine exerce cette activité depuis dix huit ans. La clientèle de Josephine se fait de plus en plus nombreuse. Compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose, Josephine sollicite un troisième prêt auprès de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1966, Ms. K. Josephine is married to Mr. ALLOSSE Théodore, a police officer.  The couple have four children, who have all had schooling.  For about twenty years, she has been living with her husband and children in the Sèdégbé district, in the community of Abomey Calavi.  The couple jointly ensure that their different family expenses are covered.  Josephine has had very little schooling.  To support herself, she runs a business selling sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, chili peppers, canned tomatoes, fried fish, eggs, etc.) out of her home.  Secondarily she sells plastic ware.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has already had two loans from ALIDé that have all been repaid.  She has been in this business for eighteen years.  Her customers are more and more numerous.  Given the few financial means at her disposal, Josephine is requesting a third loan from ALIDé with the aim of boosting her business and further satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying condiments for making sauces

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
A. Afi s’est spécialisée depuis 2000 dans la vente de boisson locale alcoolisée appelé « Sodabi ». elle s’approvisonne à l’interieur du pays dans la ville d’havé . le crédit  qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre de s’approvisionner avec 2 tonneaux de sodabi
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
Afi A. has specialized in the sale of a local alcoholic beverage called « Sodabi » since 2000. She stocks up in the interior of the country in the city of Havé. The loan that she is requesting will permit her to restock with 2 barrels of Sodabi. She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodabi

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona que en los últimos años ha experimentado un crecimiento comercial considerable. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la preparación y venta de platos típicos. El prepara diariamente anticuchos (meat kabob) y los vende por las tardes en el exterior de uno de los mercados de la ciudad. Esta actividad le brinda de ingresos estables con los cuales saca adelante a su familia. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro se ha vuelto conocido y cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles.

Herminio desea realizar algunas mejoras en la estructura de su vivienda, de modo que su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden para realizar las acciones necesarias para lograr su objetivo.

Herminio es un hombre responsable y entregado a su trabajo. Sus vecinos y clientes le consideran alguien respetuoso y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar cuando se le necesiten.
texts.en:
Herminio is 56 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the agricultural district of Cayaltí, a zone that has experienced considerable commercial growth in the last few years. It is located an hour away from Chiclayo city. For over five years, he has been preparing and selling typical dishes. Every day he prepares anticuchos (meat kabobs) and sells them in the afternoons outside of one of the city markets. This gives him a stable income with which to provide for his family. Due to the amount of time that he has been working in the area, he has become well-known and has a loyal clientele. Herminio wishes to improve the structure of his home, so that his family can have a better quality of life. To do this he has, for the first time, solicited a loan of 1000 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternatica, which will help him carry out the necessary actions to achieve his goal. Herminio is a responsible and hard-working man. His neighbors and clients consider him a respectable person and someone that is always disposed to help them when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve his housing structure

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Née le 14 Décembre 1980 à Comè, DOULLESSE Odile est mariée à Q. Emile et est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Odile habite le quartier Cocotomey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Odile a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Odile  mène comme activité la vente de haricot préparé à Cocotomey. C'est au marché de Cococodji dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi que Odile achète ses produits. Odile exerce cette activité depuis six ans. C'est la première fois que Odile sollicite un concours financier auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter sa production ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on December 14, 1980 in Comè, Ms. DOULLESSE Odile is married to Mr. Q. Emile.  She is the mother of three children, of whom two are in school.  She lives with her children and husband in the Cocotomey district, in the community of Abomey Calavi.  The couple jointly provide for their family.  Odile dropped out of secondary school.  To support herself, she runs a business selling cooked beans in Cocotomey.  She buys her supplies at the Cococodji market, in Abomey Calavi.  She has been in this business for six years.  This is the first time she has requested financial support from ALIDé in order to bolster her business and to increase her production.  This will enable Odile to satisfy her customers further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of beans and containers of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction material such as cement, iron, timber and zinc for home improvements

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: A. afi exerce comme activité génratrice de revenu le commerce  de produits d’alimentation génrale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2004. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre de s’approvisionner avec 20 cartons de boîtes de conserve.  elle a ouvert sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS BTS ». sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux charges financières de  son foyer.
texts.en:
A. Afi runs a general food products business as a means to generate revenue. She has run this business since 2004. The loan that she is requesting will allow her to re-stock with 20 boxes of canned foods. She opened her own boutique which she called « ETS BTS ». Her customer base is made up of all sorts of people. She is married and the mother of one child. With the revenue from her business, she contributes to the financial responsibilities of her house.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette  femme est très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2002 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé  où ce commerce est très développé ; afin de toucher une plus grande  clientèle elle exerce son commerce de façon  ambulante. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a su bien remboursé ; elle sollicite un troisième crédit pour acheter 4 pièces de pagnes GTP, 15 pièces de pagnes Hitarget, et 4 pièces de pagnes Wax hollandais.
texts.en:
This woman is very dynamic. To generate income she has a business selling "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics). She began in 2002, and she gets her supplies at the big market in Lomé, where this commerce thrives. In order to reach the largest number of customers, she conducts business as an itinerant vendor. She received a loan from WAGES which she was able to repay in full. She is seeking a third loan to buy 4 GTP pagnes, 4 Hitarget pagnes, and 4 "Wax hollandais" pagnes (the names refer to fabric quality and motif).

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pagnes

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
Don José es padre de familia de tres hijos, tiene la edad de 46 años, trabaja en acarreo desde hace varios años, pues anteriormente vendía ropa usada, nace la iniciativa de cambiar de trabajo ya que las ventas de ropa no le estaban generando ganancias. Tiene su vehiculo el cual adquirió al crédito, y es con el que se gana la vida día a día.
Hay días que los comercios están bajos y gana poco, lo mas dificultoso es cuando se le daña el vehiculo y los ahorro los tiene que invertir en su reparación.
Con este financiamiento dará mantenimiento a su vehiculo para poder dar su servicio de acarreo sactifactorio  a sus clientes. Y seguir trabajando para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Don José is the father of three children and is 46 years old. He has worked providing a transport service for many years. Before that he used to sell used clothing but he took the initiative to change his line of work since the sale of used clothing was not a profitable business. He has a vehicle which he was able to purchase through loans, and he uses it to earn a living from day to day. There are days where there is not much call for his services and he doesn’t earn much. The most difficult times are when his vehicle is damaged and he has to use his savings to repair it. With this loan he will put his vehicle through a maintenance check so he can provide a satisfactory transport service for his clients and continue working for his family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare tyres and vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Calmbi

texts.fr: Madame Calmbi N. est une jeune dame  très  active de 31 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Layenne  dans la localité  de Yoff. C’est une ancienne sociétaire  de la caisse qui est membre depuis octobre 2002. Elle est mariée, mère  de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre un an 6 mois et 11 ans. Elle évolue  dans le secteur du commerce d’habillement pour femmes. Elle dispose d’une cantine qu’elle a pris en location dans le même  quartier  ou elle vit. C’est  une intellectuelle qui après  sa formation en bureautique  s’est lancée dans le commerce par passion. Le crédit  de 150 000 frs qu’elle emprunte sera destine a l’achat d’habits (body, pantalon, robes et jupe) pour renforcer sa cantine. Ses bénéfices  lui permettent  de répondre  a ses propres besoins et a ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Calmbi N. is a very active young woman of 35 years who lives in the neighborhood of Layenne in the town of Yoff. She is a long-time member of the fund which she joined in October 2002. She is married, and the mother of 4 children, who range in age from one and a half to eleven years old. She has developed in the sector of women's clothing sales. She uses a little store in the market that she rented in the same neighborhood where she lives. She is an intellectual woman and, after training in the bureaucracy, followed her passion in starting up in business. The loan of 150,000 frs that she will borrow will be put towards buying new outfits (body suits, pants, dresses and skirt) to strengthen her store. Her profits will allow her to meet her own needs and those of her children.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen fund

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: D. Lucienne est née en 1961 et vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Lobozounkpa, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Lucienne est mariée à LISSANON Paul et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Lucienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins du foyer. Lucienne  n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Lucienne mène comme activité la vente de condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, huile de palme, etc.) à son domicile. Lucienne s'approvisionne au marché de Cococodji dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. C'est la deuxième fois que Lucienne sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Lucienne avait bien remboursé le premier crédit qu'elle a obtenu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lucienne D. was born in 1961 and for the last 20 years has lived in Lobozounkpa in the Aborney Calavi commune. Lucienne is married to Paul LISSANON and is mother of two children, both of whom attend school. Lucienne lives with her husband and two children. Together the couple meets the various household needs. Lucienne didn't attend school. For about 10 years, Lucienne has worked selling different sauces (tomato, onion, chilli, palm oil) from home. She gets her supplies from the Cococodji market in the Abomey Calavi commune. It's the second time that Lucienne has requested financial support from ALIDé, with a view to strengthening her business and better meeting customer demands. Lucienne diligenty repaid her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de divers condiments.

loans.name: Yawa Edem

texts.fr: A. yawa edem est une célibataire, pour subvenir à ses propres  charges, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de   détail des produits cosmétiques   et des pagnes qu’elle exerce de façon ambulante elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. N’ayant jamais obtenu du crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter 17 pièces de pagnes de différentes qualité et divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Yawa Edem A. is single, and to support herself she started a retail business seeling cosmetics and loincloths. She is a mobile vendor and she gets her supplies from the main market in Lome. Having never previously obtained credit from WAGES, she is requesting her first loan in order to buy 17 different quality loincloths, and various cosmetic products.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Hatun Finca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Hatún Finca inicia su primer ciclo con 17 socias, muchas D. ellas son vecinas.
Alejandrina es L. presidenta D. su Banco Comunal, Alejandrina es conviviente y tiene una niña D. 6 años que estudia en el primer grado D. primaria, lo que mas le gusto D. L. metodología D. Finca Perú son el incentivo a ahorrar.
Alejandrina viaja a las ferias 3 veces por semana en donD. venD. frutas variadas, productos que adquiere en el mercado D. abastos D. Ayacucho, y D. las ferias compra trigo, cebada entre otros cereales, que venD. luego en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. plátano, manzanas y mandarinas.
Alejandrina sueña con tener una bodega en su casa para dejar D. viajar y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
The community bank Hatún Finca are beginning their first loan cycle with 17 members, many of whom are neighbours. Alejandrina is the president of the community bank. She lives with her husband and has a 6 year old daughter who is studying first graD. at primary school. What Alejandrina likes most about the methodology of Finca Peru is its incentives to save money. Alejandrina travels to the markets three times a week where she sells various types of fruit, products that she purchases in the wholesale market of Ayacucho. At the markets she buys wheat, barley and other cereals which she later sells at the city markets in Ayacucho. Her loan will be used to buy bananas, apples and mandarins. Alejandrina dreams of setting up a stall in her house so that she can stop travelling, and she hopes that her daughter will grow up to be a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bananas, apples and mandarins

loans.name: Las Nazarenas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Nazarenas inicia su primer ciclo con 13 socias, que son del Barrio D. Las Nazarenas, muchas D. ellas son vecinas y familiares.
Zenaida es casada y tiene 2 hijos, D. los cuales 1 estudia. Zenaida tiene un restaurante hace 3 años, en su casa que se ubica cerca del Mercado D. Las Nazarenas, en donD. venD. comida durante todo el día, cuenta con la ayuda D. un ayudante. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Zenaida ingresa por primera vez a Finca Perú gracias a la invitación D. su promotora quien le explico todo y le pareció muy interesante, inicia este ciclo como la presidenta D. su Banco Comunal.
Su mayor sueño es que su hijos sea profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Nazarenas started its first cycle with 13 members from the Las Nazarenas neighborhood. Many of them are neighbors and relatives. Zenaida is married and has 2 children, 1 of whom is in school. Zenaida has had a restaurant for 3 years in her house located close to the Las Nazarenas market. She sells food there all day long, and has an assistant. Her loan will be investment in buying rice, sugar and oil. Zenaida is entering Finca Perú for the first time thanks to an invitation by her developer who explained everything to her. She found it interesting and she is starting this cycle as president of her communal bank. Her biggest dream is for her chidlren to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa C. est une femme mariee.Elle est mere de 3 enfants dont 2 garcons et une fille.En meme temps que le commerce,elle fait aussi de la couture.Elle achete du tissus a Dakar,les coud pour ensuite les revendre.Elle a une experience de plus de 14 ans du metier.Elle fait ce metier pour gagner sa vie et subvenir a ses propres besoins et de ses enfants.Elle compte devellopper son activite en comptant sur des financements.
texts.en:
Awa C. is married and mother of 3 children: 2 boys and a girl. As well as her work in retail, she also sews. She buys her fabrics from Dakar, sews them and resells them. She has more than 14 years experience in the profession. She does this work to earn a living, and to meet her own needs and those of her children. She needs funding in order to develop her business.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renforcement de son commerce

loans.name: Evita

texts.es:
Evita tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Cruz VerD. del distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito dedicado principalmente al cultivo D. frutas, las cuales son procesadas para ser exportadas a otros países. Pertenece a la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. cinco años a labores asociadas a la ganadería, ella cría ganado ovino y vacuno: las ovejas son criadas para ofrecerlas en venta cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo y las vacas son criadas para comercializar la leche que producen diariamente. Con estos ingresos ayuda a su esposo en el sostenimiento diario D. la economía familiar.

Evita desea adquirir alimento para mejorar la calidad D. crianza D. sus animales y obtener una mejor producción que le permita seguir adelante con su negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer entragada a su familia y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo D. sus seres queridos, en la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Evita is 56 years old, married and lives with her husband in the village of Cruz VerD., in the TambogranD. district. This district works mainly in the cultivation of fruits, which are processed for export to other countries. It is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the Province of Piura, in the Piura region. Evita has worked for more than five years in activities related to cattle-breeding. She raises both sheep and cattle: the sheep are bred to be sold once they have reached a good stage in development and the cows are bred in order to sell their milk which they produce daily. With this income she supports her husband daily with the family finances. Evita wants to buy feed to improve the quality of upbringing of her animals and to obtain greater production so that she can further her business. To achieve this goal, she has seen the need to request her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of $725. Evita is a woman who is devoted to her family who always looks after the welfare and progress of her loved ones. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and acquaintances regard her as reputable and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for improved upbringing of animals that are to be sold.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed has his business center in the central market area under the cotton tree in Makeni. He is hardworking and focused on the progress of his business. Mohamed is a single parent, with a child. He goes to work at 7:00 a.m. and back home at 6:45 p.m. He is a full-time businessman. 

Mohamed was able to solicit his initial capital from a relative and then started trading in tape recorders and radios. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. His challenge is how to run his business in a way that he is able to get his livelihood and at the same time capitalize for expansion.
 
Mohamed needs a loan to buy more stock for resale. He intends to use the proceeds from this loan to educate his child and invest some into the business.

loans.use: To buy more electronics items for resale

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: El Sr. H. O. Eliseo de 22 años de edad vive con su esposa y su pequeña hija. Vive en casa propia, la cual se encuentra ubicada en el Caserío Santa Matilde. Trabaja como obrero de campo en el fundo Robsons. El Sr. Eliseo es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora, con todas las ganas de salir adelante y  esta empezando a construir su vivienda Y es por tal motivo que requiere el préstamo para poder terminar de construirla. Su deseo, según nos comenta es terminar de construir dicha vivienda, para poder darle a su pequeña hija y a su esposa una vida mejor. El Señor Eliseo esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento propuesto por nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Mr. H. O. Eliseo is 22 years old and lives with his wife and young daughter. He lives in his own house, which is in Caserío Santa Matilde. He works as a field worker in the Robsons property. Mr. Eliseo is a responsible and hardworking person, with much motivation to succeed, and is starting to construct his own home. It is for this reason that is requesting the loan to be able to finish contructing the building. His wish is to finish constructing said home to be able to give his young daughter and wife a better life. Mr. Eliseo is very thankful for the support that we can give him through this proposed funding through our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna  N. est une commerçante  de 47 ans qui évolue dans  le commerce de marchandises marocaines. Elle a observe un arrêt  de son  activité  pendant 2 années  successives. Actuellement elle a l’intention de la redémarrer. Elle habite a Yoff Layenne et a déjà   bénéficié  de 4 crédits  au sein de l’institution  U-IMCEC. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs pour compléter  son propre  capital ce qui lui permettra de voyager sur le Maroc. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi par l’intermédiaire  de sa sœur qui allait en Gambie. Les marchandises qui seront acquises seront placées auprès  de ses clients commerçants. Plus précisément  le montant emprunte sera destine a l’achat d’habits, de chaussures, destines a la vente. Cet investissement lui permettra  d’accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Maimouna N. is 47 years old and a retailer specialising in Moroccan merchandise. She placed her business on hold for 2 years and is now looking to start up again. She lives in Yoff Layenne and has already benefited from 4 loans with the U-IMCEC. She is requesting a loan of 500 000 frs to supplement her own capital in order to travel to Morocco. She chose this activity following the example of her sister who was travelling to Gambia. The merchandise she acquires will be sold by various retailers. To be precise, the amount borrowed will be used to buy clothing and shoes for resale. This investment will allow her to increase her income.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: redemarrage activite de  commerce

loans.name: Fatoumata Bintou

texts.fr: Fatoumata Bintou B. est une femme mariee et mere 3 enfants.Elle a une boutique alimentation et vend des produits alimentaires.Elle achete ses produits au niveau des grossistes bases a ziguinchor meme.Elle a une experience de 6 ans dans ce metier.Elle fait ce metier par amour mais aussi elle en fait un moyen de gagner sa vie.Car pour elle les benefices realises vont dans les charges familiales et le reste dans l'epargne.Elle compte developper sa boutique et etre grossiste demain.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Bintou B. is married and mother of three children. She owns a shop which sells food products. She buys her products from the wholesalers based in Ziguinchor. She has 6 years experience in this profession. She does this work out of love, but also to earn a living. For her, the profits go toward meeting household expenses, and the remainder go into savings. She hopes to develop her shop and to one day become a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: pour renforcer son stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING ZINC ROOFING, SAND, CEMENT, AND BRICKS FOR HOME IMPROVEMENT

loans.name: Kadididatou

texts.fr: Kadidiatou C. est une femme de 51 ans et mère de 05 enfant en charge et également tutrice de 03 autres garçons qui lui sont confiés par des tiers. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIAMORAL depuis le 06 septembre 2005 et a 09 fois de suite bénéficier de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle vend du miel, de l'huile de palme et du jus de citron. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages environnants et dans les marchés hebdomadaires des la zone. Elle a une correspondante à Dakar qui vend pour elle moyennant une commission d'environs de 10%. Son nouveau crédit lui permet de renforcer sa marchandise (miel, huile de palme et citron) afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et et mieux participer à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou C. is a 51-year old woman and mother to five children who are in her care; she is at the same time guardian to three other boys who have been entrusted to her care by other people. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in DIAMORAL since 6th September 2005 and has had nine consecutive loans which she has always repaid without any difficulty. She sells honey, palm oil and lemon juice. She gets her supplies in the surrounding villages and in the weekly markets in the area. She has a correspondent in Dakar who sells for her for an average commission of around 10%. Her new loan will allow her to build up her stock of goods (honey, palm oil and lemons) so that she can make more money and contribute more to providing for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop a small business selling honey, palm oil and lemon juice

loans.name: Luz Cerito 3,4 Group

texts.en:
Cornelia is the coordinator of her group Luz Cerito (Guiding Light), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in L. Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town, north of the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children.

Cornelia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she is excited to invest in her business selling various snack foods. She plans to use this loan to purchase sweets to sell in her stand. She will use the profits to invest in her business with the goal of one day having a cafeteria.

loans.use: to buy candy to sell

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en: Gulnaz S. is a 39-year-old poultry breeder, married with three children. Gulnaz has four years of experience in this field and her permanent clients often come to purchase chickens and geese. Gulnaz's monthly income is about 150-200 AZN. She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more poultry and increase her income. Gulnaz also works as a teacher but the poultry business is her main source of income. She is going to start livestock breeding as her husband is an experienced cattle breeder. She will use half of her loan to purchase a calf.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and one calf

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en: Almaz A., 43 years old, makes honey and breeds bees. She has four years of experience in making honey and she also works in a honey-making factory. Almaz is married and has two sons. Her honey is very popular and in high demand among local people. Her monthly income is dependent on the season; in the summer, she earns about 300-400 AZN and in the winter her income is about 150-200 AZN. She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to expand her business and earn as much as possible during the summer period. She would like to purchase new sorts of bees which make more quality honey.

loans.use: to expand her business and purchase new sorts of bees

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en: Nizami Q. is a 55-year-old barber who has been working in a barber shop since 2000. He is married and has four children. Nizami applied for 1000 AZN to purchase new tools. He believes one day he could open his own barber shop and start a new business. Now he would like to purchase modern tools and increase his monthly turnover.

loans.use: to purchase new tools

loans.name: Nuevo Porvernir 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Angelita is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Porvenir (New Future), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity is in Free Trading Zone, a cement factory, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her two children.

Angelita is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She sells clothes and shoes in a Fantasia: a variety store that caters to women. She will use the profits to improve her home and invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.
